original: bzang ba dang ngan pa yang bde ba chen po'i ngo bor shes pas na bzang ngan shes shing ngo //
analyzed: bzang ba dang ngan pa yang bde ba chen po'i ngo bor shes pas na bzang ngan shes shing ngo //
translated: And since good and bad are known to be of the nature of great bliss, he knows good and bad.

original: dus bde ba chen po byang chub kyi skad cig shes pas na dus shes pa'o //
analyzed: dus bde ba chen po byang chub kyi skad cig shes pas na dus shes pa'o //
translated: And since he knows the moment of enlightenment, great bliss, he knows the moment.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don la khyab pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir khyab bdag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don la khyab pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir khyab bdag go //
translated: He is the lord of all, because he pervades the meaning of the mundane and the supramundane by his very nature.

original: lus dang ngag sems dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid dam tshig rnam pa bzhi shes pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid dam tshig rnam pa bzhi shes pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: He is just so, because he knows the four kinds of commitments, which are of the nature of body, speech, mind, and gnosis.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: dpal phyag na rdo rje'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: dpal phyag na rdo rje'i zhal snga nas /
translated: The glorious Vajrapani says:

original: shes rab dang 'o byed pas dga' ba'i skad cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang 'o byed pas dga' ba'i skad cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moment of joy arises from the kiss of wisdom.

original: de ni lus kyi dam tshig go //üîΩpadmar rdo rje bcug pas mchog dga'i skad cig ste ngag gi dam tshig go //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi dam tshig go // padmar rdo rje bcug pas mchog dga'i skad cig ste ngag gi dam tshig go //
translated: That is the commitment of the body.üîΩThe moment of supreme joy arises from the insertion of the vajra into the lotus; that is the commitment of speech.

original: padmar rdo rje bskyod pas khyad par gyi dga' ba'i skad cig ste sems kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: padmar rdo rje bskyod pas khyad par gyi dga' ba'i skad cig ste sems kyi dam tshig go //
translated: The moment of special joy arises from the shaking of the vajra in the lotus; that is the commitment of mind.

original: rdo rje nor bur byang chub kyi sems lhags pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i skad cig ste ye shes kyi dam tshig bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nor bur byang chub kyi sems lhags pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i skad cig ste ye shes kyi dam tshig bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth pledge of pristine awareness is to experience the instant of coemergent bliss when the bodhicitta descends to the vajra jewel.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam tshig ldan te de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam tshig ldan te de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one is pledged, because one has the nature of those pledges.

original: lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis chos ston pa la sogs pa'i dus shes pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis chos ston pa la sogs pa'i dus shes pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: One is just so, because one knows the time for teaching the Dharma and so forth by spontaneous accomplishment.

original: thung pa nyid ni ga tsug la ga yin @72a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thung pa nyid ni ga tsug la ga yin @72a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is short, because one is small.

original: dga' ba bzhi'i skad cig zos pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems can dbang po shes so //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi'i skad cig zos pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su shes pa'i phyir sems can dbang po shes so //
translated: One knows the faculties of sentient beings, because one knows the faculties of all sentient beings by experiencing the four joys.

original: las kyi kun rtog mchog gi phyag rgya'i sgo nas sa la spyod pa dang mkha' la spyod pa dang / phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rnam grol gsum mo //
analyzed: las kyi kun rtog mchog gi phyag rgya'i sgo nas sa la spyod pa dang mkha' la spyod pa dang / phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi rnam grol gsum mo //
translated: One is skilled in the three types of liberation: the liberation of enjoying the earth, the liberation of enjoying the sky, and the liberation of the great seal, through the supreme seal of the imagination of action.

original: de la mkhas pa po rtog pa po'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa po rtog pa po'o //
translated: One is imaginative, because one is skilled in those.

original: lhan cig skyes pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin rdul mun pa snying stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir yon tan dang ldan zhing ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin rdul mun pa snying stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir yon tan dang ldan zhing ngo //
translated: It is endowed with qualities, because it has the qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas, which are inseparable from the innate nature.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir yon tan shes so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir yon tan shes so //
translated: It knows the qualities, because it knows the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bde ba chen po myong ba'i phyir chos shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bde ba chen po myong ba'i phyir chos shes so //
translated: It knows the Dharma, because it experiences the supramundane Dharma of great bliss.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes 'chang bi rim pas 'gro ba thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir bsngags pa ste ye shes kyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes 'chang bi rim pas 'gro ba thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir bsngags pa ste ye shes kyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is praise, because it is the body of gnosis, which is the bearer of true gnosis, which gradually leads all beings to peace.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bkra shis rnams 'di las 'byung bas na bkra shis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bkra shis rnams 'di las 'byung bas na bkra shis 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the source of auspiciousness, because the supramundane auspiciousness arises from it.

original: bkra shis dga' ba gsum po kun gyi yang bkra shis pa bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste 'od gsal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bkra shis dga' ba gsum po kun gyi yang bkra shis pa bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste 'od gsal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the fourth auspiciousness, because it is the auspiciousness of all three joys, which is the innate joy, because it is clear light.

original: rtag tu 'jig pa med pa'i bde ba grags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir grags so //
analyzed: rtag tu 'jig pa med pa'i bde ba grags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir grags so //
translated: It is renowned because it is the nature of the eternal, non-perishable bliss.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir bkra shis so ;
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir bkra shis so ;
translated: It is auspicious because it is the basis of all perfection.

original: / rnam par rtog pa yongs su dor ba las byung ba dri ma dang bral bal 'od gsal gyi snyan grags can gyi phyir snyan grags so //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa yongs su dor ba las byung ba dri ma dang bral bal 'od gsal gyi snyan grags can gyi phyir snyan grags so //
translated: It is renowned because it is renowned as the clear light, which arises from the abandonment of all conceptual thought and is free from all stains.

original: bde ba thams cad bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dge ba'o //
translated: It is virtuous because it is the nature of the accumulation of all bliss.

original: srog rtsol gsal ba'i dngos pos srog aa wa dh'u t'ir son pa nyid kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbugs kyi phyir dbugs 'byin chen po'o //
analyzed: srog rtsol gsal ba'i dngos pos srog aa wa dh'u t'ir son pa nyid kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbugs kyi phyir dbugs 'byin chen po'o //
translated: It is the great inspiration because it is the supramundane breath, the life-force that has entered the avadh≈´tƒ´ by the clarity of the life-force.

original: bde ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dga' ston nyid kyi phyir dga' ston che'o //
analyzed: bde ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dga' ston nyid kyi phyir dga' ston che'o //
translated: It is the great festival because it is the festival of uninterrupted bliss.

original: brjod du med cing gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dga' ba rab tu gsal bas 'gro ba dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dga' chen no //
analyzed: brjod du med cing gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dga' ba rab tu gsal bas 'gro ba dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dga' chen no //
translated: It is the great joy because it is the nature of the joy of beings, the clarity of the inexpressible, non-dual Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad bde ba chen pos tshim pa'i phyir rol pa chen bo'o //üîΩbde ba chen po'i bdag nyid can yin pas mchod bar 'os pa'i phyir bkur sti byang sems kyi khu bas lus kyi rtsa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde ba chen pos tshim pa'i phyir rol pa chen bo'o // bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid can yin pas mchod bar 'os pa'i phyir bkur sti byang sems kyi khu bas lus kyi rtsa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is a great play because it satisfies all sentient beings with great bliss.üîΩIt is a great worship because it is fit to be worshipped, since it is the nature of great bliss.

original: don dam pa'i dbang rim gro'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rim gro'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbang rim gro'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rim gro'o //
translated: It is a great service because it is the essence of service, the ultimate empowerment.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i @72b bde ba'i gzhi nyid kyi phyir phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i @72b bde ba'i gzhi nyid kyi phyir phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is a great perfection because it is the basis of uninterrupted bliss.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems bde ba mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems bde ba mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is a great delight because it possesses the supreme joy of the bliss of body, speech and mind.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba grags pa'i rje bo nyid kyis grags bdag dpal te ye shes sku zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba grags pa'i rje bo nyid kyis grags bdag dpal te ye shes sku zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the glorious lord of fame because it is the master of the fame of bliss and mental joy. It is the wisdom body.

original: rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i phyir mchog ldan te rab mchog go //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i phyir mchog ldan te rab mchog go //
translated: It is the supreme possessor because it is the supreme, the body of wisdom that is pure in every way.

original: rnam bar mi rtog ba'i sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su skong ba'i phyir mchog sbyin te 'od gsal mchog tu sbyin pa ji srid pa'o //
analyzed: rnam bar mi rtog ba'i sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su skong ba'i phyir mchog sbyin te 'od gsal mchog tu sbyin pa ji srid pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme gift, because it fulfills the wishes of nonconceptual sentient beings, as long as it is the supreme gift of clear light.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa mchog nyid kyi phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa mchog nyid kyi phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: It is the chief, because of the supremacy of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'od gsal gyi ye shes nye bar bstan pas chags pa la sogs pa srung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi ye shes nye bar bstan pas chags pa la sogs pa srung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the protector, because it protects from passion, etc., by teaching the clear light intuition.

original: chags pa chen po 'char bas bde ba chen po'i ngo bo stobs pa'i phyir skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa chen po 'char bas bde ba chen po'i ngo bo stobs pa'i phyir skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme refuge, because it is the source of great bliss, arising from the great passion.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan dbang du gyur pa zhan pa rnams kyi skyabs kyi 'os so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan dbang du gyur pa zhan pa rnams kyi skyabs kyi 'os so //
translated: It is the refuge of those who are weak, who are subject to other conceptual thoughts.

original: 'khor ba'i bag chags kyi 'jigs chen 'joms pa po nyid kyi phyir 'jigs chen dgra ste'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bag chags kyi 'jigs chen 'joms pa po nyid kyi phyir 'jigs chen dgra ste'o //
translated: It is the great fear of the enemy, because it destroys the great fear of the instinct for life in cyclic existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab kyi mchog go //
translated: It is the best of the best, for that very reason.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyis spros pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po ste sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis dag pa'i sku'i gzugs sna tshogs pa 'phro ba zhas pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyis spros pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po ste sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis dag pa'i sku'i gzugs sna tshogs pa 'phro ba zhas pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: Since it is emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations, it is the dispeller of all fear, for it conquers all the fears of conceptual elaboration.

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: de phyir skyes shing 'jigs med srid pa rnam pa gsum song rgyal ba yi ni dag ba'i sku //
analyzed: de phyir skyes shing 'jigs med srid pa rnam pa gsum song rgyal ba yi ni dag ba'i sku //
translated: Therefore, having been born, you have gone beyond the three states of existence, O Victorious One, your body of perfect purity,

original: las kyis gnod par gyur kyang rtag tu sems can don dag rgyal ba'i bdag po 'dor mi mdzad //
analyzed: las kyis gnod par gyur kyang rtag tu sems can don dag rgyal ba'i bdag po 'dor mi mdzad //
translated: And though you are harmed by karma, you never abandon the welfare of beings, O Lord of the Victorious Ones.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten dbang phyug kho bo srid gsum gnas dang las kyis ra gnas nyi ma nyid //üîΩsems can rnams la lam ster dmyal ba'i 'jigs sel lha gzhan nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten dbang phyug kho bo srid gsum gnas dang las kyis ra gnas nyi ma nyid // sems can rnams la lam ster dmyal ba'i 'jigs sel lha gzhan nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Thus, I, the Lord of the World, dwell in the three states of existence, dwelling in the world through karma,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: And I bestow the path upon beings, dispelling the fears of the hells, but there is no other god.

original: rjes su dran pa'i yan lag gsal ba'i dngos pos gtum mo 'bar ba'i rtse mo de dang ldan pas gtsug phung can no //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i yan lag gsal ba'i dngos pos gtum mo 'bar ba'i rtse mo de dang ldan pas gtsug phung can no //
translated: The crest-jewel is endowed with the peak of the blazing ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ through the clear entity of the branch of recollection.

original: ma'i nyi ma dang 'brel ba'i pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag dang / pha'i zla ba dang 'brel pa'i rus pa dang rgyus pa dang khu ba ste de gnyis dang ldan pa phud pu'o //
analyzed: ma'i nyi ma dang 'brel ba'i pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag dang / pha'i zla ba dang 'brel pa'i rus pa dang rgyus pa dang khu ba ste de gnyis dang ldan pa phud pu'o //
translated: The topknot is endowed with both the skin, flesh, and blood connected with the mother‚Äôs sun and the bones, sinews, and semen connected with the father‚Äôs moon.

original: de sgrib pa med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas phung po chan no //
analyzed: de sgrib pa med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas phung po chan no //
translated: The great aggregate is endowed with the yoga of unobstructed activity.

original: ral pa'i lcang lo mtha' dag bcings pa'i bzhin chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid du ldan pa'i @73a * //üîΩphyir lcang lo can no //
analyzed: ral pa'i lcang lo mtha' dag bcings pa'i bzhin chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid du ldan pa'i @73a * // phyir lcang lo can no //
translated: The crest-jewel is endowed with the single taste of all phenomena because the entire mass of hair is bound.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du dngos po thams cad ngo bo gcig pas ral pa can no //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du dngos po thams cad ngo bo gcig pas ral pa can no //
translated: The topknot is endowed with the nature of the unchanging because all entities are of one taste.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag bzhar ba'i phyir mgo zlum mo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag bzhar ba'i phyir mgo zlum mo //
translated: The shaven head is endowed with the shaving of all conceptual thoughts of affliction.

original: cod pan gtsug tor chen po'o //
analyzed: cod pan gtsug tor chen po'o //
translated: The crown protrusion is the great u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir cod pan thogs so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir cod pan thogs so //
translated: The crown is endowed with that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can chos kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa med par byas pa'i srog la sogs pa'i rlung nyid kyi phyir gdong lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can chos kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa med par byas pa'i srog la sogs pa'i rlung nyid kyi phyir gdong lnga ste /
translated: He has five faces because he is the five Tathagatas, because he is the nature of the aggregates of Dharma, and because he is the life-force, etc., winds that are unobstructed.

original: rigs lnga'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthe nature of the five families.‚Äù

original: snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba thob pa dang / 'og gsal dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid gtsug phud lnga gang gi yin pa de gtsug phud lnga dang ldan no //
analyzed: snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba thob pa dang / 'og gsal dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid gtsug phud lnga gang gi yin pa de gtsug phud lnga dang ldan no //
translated: He has five topknots because he has the five topknots that are the characteristics of appearance, increase of appearance, near attainment, appearance, and the realm of reality.

original: sad pa dang / rmi lam dang / gnyid log dang / bzhi pa dang / bzhi pa 'das pa'i zur phud lnga pa'i me tog thod kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir zur phud lnga pa me tog thod do //
analyzed: sad pa dang / rmi lam dang / gnyid log dang / bzhi pa dang / bzhi pa 'das pa'i zur phud lnga pa'i me tog thod kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir zur phud lnga pa me tog thod do //
translated: He has five topknots and a flower topknot because he is the nature of the five topknots of the awakened, dreaming, sleeping, fourth, and beyond the fourth states.

original: moonydza byang chub kyi sems mi 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: moonydza byang chub kyi sems mi 'dzag pa'o //
translated: Mo√±ju is the non-emission of bodhicitta.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir moonydza'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir moonydza'o //
translated: He is Mo√±ju because he possesses that.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rang bzhin med par byed pas brtul zhugs chen po'o //üîΩde 'dzin pa nyi de zhin bshad do //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rang bzhin med par byed pas brtul zhugs chen po'o // de 'dzin pa nyi de zhin bshad do //
translated: natureless.

original: byang sems mi 'dzag pa nyid kyi phyir tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang sems mi 'dzag pa nyid kyi phyir tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: It is celibacy because the bodhisattva does not emit semen.

original: de nyid kyis brtul zhugs mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyis brtul zhugs mchog go //
translated: It is the supreme vow because of that.

original: mchog tu bde bas gang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du byed pa'i phyir dka' thub mthar phyir pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog tu bde bas gang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon du byed pa'i phyir dka' thub mthar phyir pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: It is the completion of asceticism because it actualizes all the qualities of the Buddha filled with supreme bliss.

original: rtag tu padma dang rdo rje yang dag par sbyor ba goms pas thig le'i dbus su dbugs drug thim par byed pas thig le de rdo rje'i kha'i bza' ba'i mtshan nyid dka' thub chen po gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag tu padma dang rdo rje yang dag par sbyor ba goms pas thig le'i dbus su dbugs drug thim par byed pas thig le de rdo rje'i kha'i bza' ba'i mtshan nyid dka' thub chen po gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: It is the great asceticism because it causes the dissolution of the six breaths in the middle of the drop through the practice of always uniting the lotus and vajra.

original: sbyor yan lag drug yongs su rdzogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bde ba chen po'i chu bor rtag tu bkrus pa'i phyir gtsang gnas so //
analyzed: sbyor yan lag drug yongs su rdzogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bde ba chen po'i chu bor rtag tu bkrus pa'i phyir gtsang gnas so //
translated: Since it is always washed in the river of inconceivable great bliss that is complete with the six limbs of union, it is a pure abode.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i phyir dam pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i phyir dam pa'o //
translated: Since it is innate joy, it is supreme.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba nyid kyi phyir goo ta ma sh'akya thub pa don grub po //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba nyid kyi phyir goo ta ma sh'akya thub pa don grub po //
translated: Since it is unchanging bliss, it is Gautama, ≈öƒÅkyamuni, and SiddhƒÅrtha.

original: yi ge lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ham gi rnam pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi bram ze'o //
analyzed: yi ge lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ham gi rnam pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi bram ze'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of the five syllables, it is a brahmin, the form of ha·πÉ, which is the nature of the five sugatas.

original: de'i n'a da khong du chud nas gang zhig spyi bor thim pas rnam par rtog pa'i rlung thams cad rgyu bar byed pas na bram ze'o //
analyzed: de'i n'a da khong du chud nas gang zhig spyi bor thim pas rnam par rtog pa'i rlung thams cad rgyu bar byed pas na bram ze'o //
translated: Since it causes the movement of all conceptual winds by dissolving into the head, it is a brahmin.

original: nam mkha' la chags pa'i sems can nyid kyi so sor sdud pa @73b la sogs pa yan lag drug bsdus pas tshang pa'i gnas yan lag bzhi pa bsam gtan bzhi'i zhal bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi phyir tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la chags pa'i sems can nyid kyi so sor sdud pa @73b la sogs pa yan lag drug bsdus pas tshang pa'i gnas yan lag bzhi pa bsam gtan bzhi'i zhal bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi phyir tshangs pa'o //
translated: Since it is the abode that is complete with the four limbs‚Äîthe four faces of the four meditative concentrations‚Äîwhich subsume the six branches such as the totalities, it is BrahmƒÅ.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbye med pa'i ye shes ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbye med pa'i ye shes ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: The pristine wisdom of emptiness, which is naturally radiant and indivisible from compassion, is Brahman.

original: de de'i bdag nyid du rig pa nyams su myong bas na tshangs pa shes so //
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid du rig pa nyams su myong bas na tshangs pa shes so //
translated: Since one experiences the realization of that nature, one knows Brahman.

original: tshangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa tshangs pa dga' bo //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa tshangs pa dga' bo //
translated: The nirvana of Brahman is the nirvana of Brahman, which is delightful.

original: dga' ba tshangs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa gsungs pa'i phyir de thob pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba tshangs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa gsungs pa'i phyir de thob pa'o //
translated: Since it is said that delight is the nature of Brahman, one attains that.

original: stong pa nyid yang dag par nyams su myong ba nyid kyis nam mkha' ji srid par 'jigs pa med pa'i bde bar son pa'i phyir thar pa bzhi pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yang dag par nyams su myong ba nyid kyis nam mkha' ji srid par 'jigs pa med pa'i bde bar son pa'i phyir thar pa bzhi pa'i don to //
translated: Since one has attained the bliss of fearlessness for as long as space exists by means of the experience of emptiness itself, it is the meaning of the fourth liberation.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mes rdul mun pa snying stobs thal bar byas pa'i phung po nyid kyis rnam grol kho na lus rang bzhin gnas yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mes rdul mun pa snying stobs thal bar byas pa'i phung po nyid kyis rnam grol kho na lus rang bzhin gnas yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: Since the aggregates are burned to ashes by the fire of correct pristine wisdom, which is sattva, rajas, and tamas, the body is liberated itself, and that is the nature of the abode.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa 'ching ba dang bral bas 'dod yon lnga la longs spyod pas chags pa chen po yang dag par yongs su shes pa thob pa'i phyir rnam grol bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa 'ching ba dang bral bas 'dod yon lnga la longs spyod pas chags pa chen po yang dag par yongs su shes pa thob pa'i phyir rnam grol bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is liberated because he has attained the perfect knowledge of great passion, enjoying the five sense objects without being bound by natural attachment and so forth.üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / 'jig rten chags pas 'ching 'gyur pa //
analyzed: de yang / 'jig rten chags pas 'ching 'gyur pa //
translated: The world is bound by attachment.

original: 'dod chags nyid kyis rnam par grol //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid kyis rnam par grol //
translated: It is liberated by attachment itself.

original: bzlog pa'i bsgom pa de dag ni //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i bsgom pa de dag ni //
translated: Those who meditate on the reversal

original: sangs rgyas mu stegs kyis mi shes //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mu stegs kyis mi shes //
translated: Are not known by Buddhists or tƒ´rthikas.

original: dug gi dum bu gang nyid kyis //
analyzed: dug gi dum bu gang nyid kyis //
translated: The very piece of poison

original: srog chags thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: srog chags thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: By which all living beings die,

original: dug gi de nyid shes pa des //
analyzed: dug gi de nyid shes pa des //
translated: By knowing the reality of that poison,

original: dug gis dug ni 'joms par byed //
analyzed: dug gis dug ni 'joms par byed //
translated: Poison is destroyed by poison.

original: ji ltar me yis tshig pa ni //
analyzed: ji ltar me yis tshig pa ni //
translated: Just as what is burned by fire

original: slar yang me yis 'joms par byed //
analyzed: slar yang me yis 'joms par byed //
translated: Is burned again by fire,

original: de bzhin 'dod chags mes tshig pa //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags mes tshig pa //
translated: Likewise, one burned by the fire of passion

original: 'dod chags me yis zhi bar byed //
analyzed: 'dod chags me yis zhi bar byed //
translated: Is pacified by the fire of passion.üîΩBy whatever means living beings

original: gang dang gang gis srog chags dag / drag po'i las kyis 'ching 'gyur pa //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis srog chags dag / drag po'i las kyis 'ching 'gyur pa //
translated: Are bound by fierce actions,

original: de dag thabs ni de nyid kyis //üîΩsrid pa'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag thabs ni de nyid kyis // srid pa'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
translated: By that very method,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: they are freed from the bondage of existence.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te ches phra'i sems kyi myu gu la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te ches phra'i sems kyi myu gu la //
translated: if the sprout of the subtle mind

original: dag pa'i yul gyi bcud kyis ma bran na //üîΩnam mkha' khyab pa'i 'bras bu ster ba yi //
analyzed: dag pa'i yul gyi bcud kyis ma bran na // nam mkha' khyab pa'i 'bras bu ster ba yi //
translated: is not watered with the moisture of pure objects,üîΩhow can one obtain the wish-fulfilling tree

original: dpag bsam ljon shing nyid ni ji ltar 'thob //üîΩkha cig yul rnams dag ni spangs nas te //
analyzed: dpag bsam ljon shing nyid ni ji ltar 'thob // kha cig yul rnams dag ni spangs nas te //
translated: that grants the fruit of pervading space?üîΩSome, having abandoned objects,

original: kha cig yul rnams ma bkag par byas nas //
analyzed: kha cig yul rnams ma bkag par byas nas //
translated: some, having not blocked objects,

original: kha cig yul rnams kho na nyid kyis te //
analyzed: kha cig yul rnams kho na nyid kyis te //
translated: some, by the very nature of objects,

original: mi yi khyu mchog rnams ni byang chub byed //üîΩces so // stong pa nyid kyi ye shes @74a * //
analyzed: mi yi khyu mchog rnams ni byang chub byed // ces so // stong pa nyid kyi ye shes @74a * //
translated: the best of men become enlightened.

original: kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes mes dpa' bsgom pa byang sems zhi ba ste /
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes mes dpa' bsgom pa byang sems zhi ba ste /
translated: Because of being the nature of the wisdom of emptiness, the cultivation of the wisdom fire of all tathƒÅgatas is the bodhisattva's peace,

original: zhi ba rtag tu dge ba zhe ba ste zhes so //
analyzed: zhi ba rtag tu dge ba zhe ba ste zhes so //
translated: as stated in the line peace, always virtuous, peace.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa sems kyi g-yeng ba rnams bzhi ba'i phyir zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa sems kyi g-yeng ba rnams bzhi ba'i phyir zhi ba nyid do //
translated: It is peace because it is free from the distractions of mind, such as the grasped and the grasper.

original: de yang / zhi ba myang 'das khams yin no //
analyzed: de yang / zhi ba myang 'das khams yin no //
translated: And that is the realm of nirvana, peace.

original: zhes te / las kyi phyag rgya bsten phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig pa yi bde thob pa //
analyzed: zhes te / las kyi phyag rgya bsten phyir ro // gang zhig pa yi bde thob pa //
translated: Because of relying on the karmamudra.üîΩThe bliss that is attained by him

original: de yi bde ba rang nyid bza' //üîΩgsad pa gang gis lus bde la //
analyzed: de yi bde ba rang nyid bza' // gsad pa gang gis lus bde la //
translated: is the bliss that he himself enjoys.üîΩThe bliss that comes from killing the body

original: de yi bde ba bsam gtan brjod //
analyzed: de yi bde ba bsam gtan brjod //
translated: is called the bliss of concentration.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: phyi rol du gyur pa rnams med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ste de tsam zhig dmigs pa'i phyir mya ngan 'das so //
analyzed: phyi rol du gyur pa rnams med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ste de tsam zhig dmigs pa'i phyir mya ngan 'das so //
translated: It is nirvana because it is the object of the nonexistence of external things, because it is the object of just that much.

original: ma bcos pa'i rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir phyag rgya chen po shes rab kyi snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: ma bcos pa'i rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir phyag rgya chen po shes rab kyi snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it is the nature of the light of the wisdom of the mahamudra, which is to be known by oneself without fabrication.

original: dngos po dang dngos med mchog tu bzod pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir mya ngan 'das so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos med mchog tu bzod pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir mya ngan 'das so //
translated: It is nirvana because it is emptiness, the supreme patience with respect to entity and nonentity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir legs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir legs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is excellent.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mya ngan las 'da' bas na mya ngan 'das pa bde ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mya ngan las 'da' bas na mya ngan 'das pa bde ba'o //
translated: Since all Buddhas are beyond sorrow, nirvana is bliss.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas mthar phyin pa'i bde ba'i phyir nye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas mthar phyin pa'i bde ba'i phyir nye ba'o //
translated: Since it is the bliss of the ultimate, it is near, free from all conceptualization.

original: thabs dang shes rab dag la bde sdug gnyis med pa'i phyir bde sdug sel bar thar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dag la bde sdug gnyis med pa'i phyir bde sdug sel bar thar gyur pa'o //
translated: Since there is neither pleasure nor pain in means and wisdom, it is the liberation that removes pleasure and pain.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: sdig dang bsod nams gnyis ni gzegs ma phub mar song //
analyzed: sdig dang bsod nams gnyis ni gzegs ma phub mar song //
translated: Sin and merit are like a grain of mustard seed,

original: rang gi yid ni stong pa nyid gtad do //
analyzed: rang gi yid ni stong pa nyid gtad do //
translated: The mind is directed to emptiness.

original: zhes so // rang bzhin gyis chags pa dang bral bas mi 'dzag pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir chags bral bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
analyzed: zhes so // rang bzhin gyis chags pa dang bral bas mi 'dzag pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir chags bral bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
translated: Since it is the nature of great bliss that does not drip, free from natural attachment, it is the Lord, free from attachment.

original: bag chags dang bral bas chos ston pa'i sgo nas shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir lus las 'das pa po'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bral bas chos ston pa'i sgo nas shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir lus las 'das pa po'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of the wisdom of the sphere of reality, very pure, through teaching the Dharma, free from habitual tendencies, it is the one who has gone beyond the body.

original: 'od gsal nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas mi thub pas thub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas mi thub pas thub pa med pa'o //
translated: It is invincible because it cannot be overcome by the concepts of clear light, etc.

original: chags pa chen po mi 'dzag pa nyid kyis bde ba thams cad dpe dang bral ba ni dpe med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa chen po mi 'dzag pa nyid kyis bde ba thams cad dpe dang bral ba ni dpe med pa'o //
translated: It is incomparable because of the absence of emission of great passion, and because of the absence of all bliss.

original: snang ba la sogs pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi mngon no //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi mngon no //
translated: It is non-substantial because of the absence of the nature of light, etc., and of the nature of woman, etc.

original: 'od gsal gyi phyir mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi phyir mi snang ba'o //
translated: It is non-apparent because of clear light.

original: khu ba dang rdul mi 'dzag pa nyid kyis nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa'i phyir gsal byed min no //
analyzed: khu ba dang rdul mi 'dzag pa nyid kyis nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa'i phyir gsal byed min no //
translated: It is non-manifest because of the absence of emission of semen and ovum, and because of the absence of pollution like space.

original: tshes gcig la sogs pa cha bco lnga 'das pas mi 'gyur pa cha shas med @74b pa'o ;
analyzed: tshes gcig la sogs pa cha bco lnga 'das pas mi 'gyur pa cha shas med @74b pa'o ;
translated: It is partless because of the absence of change due to the passing of the fifteen parts beginning with the first of the month.

original: / ye shes nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir kun 'gro'o //
analyzed: / ye shes nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir kun 'gro'o //
translated: It is all-pervading because of the nature of space-like intuition.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir khyab pa po'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir khyab pa po'o //
translated: It is the pervader because of the nature of the animate and inanimate.

original: yid kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir phra zhing ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir phra zhing ngo //
translated: It is subtle because of the absence of mental objects.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir zag med do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir zag med do //
translated: It is uncontaminated because it is to be realized by each one's own gnosis of the ultimate realm.

original: lhun gyis grub par bde ba thams cad skye ba'i phyir sa bon nyid do //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par bde ba thams cad skye ba'i phyir sa bon nyid do //
translated: It is a seed because all bliss is spontaneously present.

original: chags pa dang chags bral dang dbu ma'i chags pa'i rdul med pa'i phyir rdul med de chags pa chen po bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang chags bral dang dbu ma'i chags pa'i rdul med pa'i phyir rdul med de chags pa chen po bzhi pa'o //
translated: It is without dust because it is free from the dust of attachment, nonattachment, and the middle way between them, and it is the fourth great attachment.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rdul bral lo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rdul bral lo //
translated: It is free from dust because it is the essence of the purity of thusness.

original: glo bur gyi dru ma med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dru ma med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from adventitious stains.

original: rang bzhin dang bral ba nyes pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral ba nyes pa spangs pa'o //
translated: It is free from faults because it is free from faults by nature.

original: phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'i nad zad pa'i phyir skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'i nad zad pa'i phyir skyon med pa'o //
translated: It is faultless because it is free from the disease of external distractions.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i 'od gsal khong du chud pa'i phyir shin tu sad pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i 'od gsal khong du chud pa'i phyir shin tu sad pa'o //
translated: It is well awakened because it is the realization of unmistaken luminosity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams lhan skyes nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir sad pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams lhan skyes nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir sad pa'i bdag go //
translated: It is the self of awakening because it is the realization of the aggregates of form and so on as the innate nature.

original: chos thams cad ye shes kyi ngo bo yang dag par gzhag pa'i phyir kun shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ye shes kyi ngo bo yang dag par gzhag pa'i phyir kun shes so //
translated: He is omniscient because all dharmas are established as the essence of gnosis.

original: lhun gyis grub pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir kun rig go //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir kun rig go //
translated: He is all-knowing because he knows the mental behavior of all sentient beings spontaneously.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam pa po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam pa po'o //
translated: For that very reason, he is the best.

original: mig la sogs pa med pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa med pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: He is the reality of the ƒÅlaya-vij√±ƒÅna because he is free from eyes and so forth.

original: de las 'das pa rgal ba snying rje rab tu rtog pas stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las 'das pa rgal ba snying rje rab tu rtog pas stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: He is the one who has crossed over that, the one who has realized great compassion, the one whose nature is emptiness.

original: spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i 'od gsal gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kho na ye shes so //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i 'od gsal gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kho na ye shes so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn alone is gnosis because he is the nature of luminosity that transcends all conceptual elaborations.

original: de nyid zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir gnyis med tshul 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir gnyis med tshul 'chang ba'o //
translated: He alone is the bearer of the nondual mode because he is the nature of the profound and the vast.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: He is nonconceptual because he is free from the concepts of ultimate gnosis.üîΩAnd that is also said:

original: de yang / dam pa'i don gyi rnam rtog kyang //
analyzed: de yang / dam pa'i don gyi rnam rtog kyang //
translated: Even the concepts of the ultimate

original: mkhas pas blang bar mi bya'o //üîΩbzang ba'am ngan pa'i rnam rtog kyang //
analyzed: mkhas pas blang bar mi bya'o // bzang ba'am ngan pa'i rnam rtog kyang //
translated: The wise do not accept it.üîΩWhat kind of distinction is there

original: dbye ba'i rnam pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: dbye ba'i rnam pa ci zhig yod //
translated: between good and bad thoughts?

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: It is just as it is said:

original: lhun gyis grub pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod pa'i bde ba'i phyir 'bad pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod pa'i bde ba'i phyir 'bad pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effortless enjoyment of the five sense-objects is just like that.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And again:

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyis bkrun  rtag tu lhun gyis grub par gzhan don no //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyis bkrun  rtag tu lhun gyis grub par gzhan don no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of his former vows, he always effortlessly benefits others.

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩnyin mo dang mtshan mo dang thun mtshams @75a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang thun mtshams @75a * //
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩDay and night, in the three periods of the day,üîΩ

original: gyi ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi dbye bas dus gsum du yang dag par byung ba'i sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos kyi sku zhes bya ba sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gyi ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi dbye bas dus gsum du yang dag par byung ba'i sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos kyi sku zhes bya ba sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Buddha is the emanation body, the beatific body, and the truth body, which arise in the three times, by the division into the concentrations of day, night, and twilight.

original: de rnams kyi las sems can gyi don gyi ngo bo bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba byed pa po'o zhes pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi las sems can gyi don gyi ngo bo bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba byed pa po'o zhes pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: The function of those is the experience of the essence of the benefit of sentient beings, which is great bliss.

original: dngos po thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi khong du chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi khong du chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Buddha is so called because he has realized the sameness of all things.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis thog ma dang tha mar skyes pa dang 'gag pa dga' bral gyi skad cig 'dzag pa'i skad cig med pa gang yin ba de de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis thog ma dang tha mar skyes pa dang 'gag pa dga' bral gyi skad cig 'dzag pa'i skad cig med pa gang yin ba de de bzhin no //
translated: The essence of the dharmadhatu is suchness, which is without beginning or end, without arising or cessation, without the moment of the bliss of separation, and without the moment of emission.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / rnam par byang ba can gyi chos rnams don dam par na med pas na med pa aa dgag pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / rnam par byang ba can gyi chos rnams don dam par na med pas na med pa aa dgag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the negation a is that ultimately afflicted and purified phenomena do not exist.

original: des na thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas dang po'i sangs rgyas te skad cig la rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu sgyur 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas dang po'i sangs rgyas te skad cig la rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu sgyur 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the primordial Buddha, the first Buddha, is the bliss of the nature of perfect enlightenment, which is the five aspects in an instant and the twenty aspects through the net of illusions.

original: gang gi rgyu thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos spangs pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi rgyu thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos spangs pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the primordial Buddha is just as it is, the cause of which is the nature of method and wisdom, abandoning the phenomena of the nature of subject and object.

original: ye shes gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ye shes gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: It is the gnosis of nondual gnosis.

original: chos thams cad bde bar mthong ba'i phyir mig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad bde bar mthong ba'i phyir mig go //
translated: It is the eye because all phenomena are seen as bliss.

original: de nyid gcig ste gnyis pa med pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid gcig ste gnyis pa med pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as it is, that which is single and not dual.

original: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir dri ma med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir dri ma med do //
translated: It is stainless because all conceptuality is abandoned.

original: ye shes stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te de nyid kyi lus can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i snang ba 'di'i yin pa de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: ye shes stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te de nyid kyi lus can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i snang ba 'di'i yin pa de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The wisdom of emptiness is the wisdom of emptiness. The body of that is the appearance of coemergent bliss. That is explained as it is.

original: de bzhin las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the karmamudra, and so on, is suchness.

original: der gshegs pa dga' ba la sogs pa bde ba'i ye shes gang gi yin pa de de bzhin gshegs so //üîΩgzhom du med pa'i sgra kun nas rgyas pas sems kyi skad cig thams cad kyi ngo bo sangs rgyas rnams tshim par byed pa'i phyir ngag rnams kyi dbang phyug ni ngag gi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: der gshegs pa dga' ba la sogs pa bde ba'i ye shes gang gi yin pa de de bzhin gshegs so // gzhom du med pa'i sgra kun nas rgyas pas sems kyi skad cig thams cad kyi ngo bo sangs rgyas rnams tshim par byed pa'i phyir ngag rnams kyi dbang phyug ni ngag gi dbang phyug go //
translated: The one who goes there, whose wisdom of bliss is joy, and so on, is a tathagata.üîΩThe lord of speech is the lord of speech, because all the buddhas are satisfied by the nature of all moments of mind through the sound of the indestructible pervading everywhere.

original: srub dang bsrub pa'i sbyor bas rtag tu aa'i rnam pa las rgyas pa'i phyir smra ba rnams kyis mchod par bya ba'i phyir smra ba che ste /
analyzed: srub dang bsrub pa'i sbyor bas rtag tu aa'i rnam pa las rgyas pa'i phyir smra ba rnams kyis mchod par bya ba'i phyir smra ba che ste /
translated: The great speaker is the great speaker, because the form of A is always expanded by the union of copulation.

original: bsrub par bya ba rtsa thams cad du bsrub pa'i ngo bo srog gi rlung gi spyor bas byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa nyid kyi dbang po dang khams thams cad rgyas par byed pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bsrub par bya ba rtsa thams cad du bsrub pa'i ngo bo srog gi rlung gi spyor bas byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa nyid kyi dbang po dang khams thams cad rgyas par byed pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The one who is to be churned is the life-force wind, which is the essence of the churning in all the channels. By the practice of holding the bodhicitta, all the faculties and elements are nourished.

original: gnyis su med @75b par smra ba'i phyir smra ba'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med @75b par smra ba'i phyir smra ba'i skyes bu'o //
translated: He is the man of speech because he speaks of nonduality.

original: phyag rgya mchog gi sbyor bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bzlog pa'i phyir smra ba'i rgyal lo //
analyzed: phyag rgya mchog gi sbyor bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bzlog pa'i phyir smra ba'i rgyal lo //
translated: He is the king of speech because he turns away the nirvƒÅ·πáa of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on by the union of the supreme mudra.

original: chos thams cad yang dag par khong du chud pa'i phyir smra ba'i dam pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par khong du chud pa'i phyir smra ba'i dam pa'o //
translated: He is the best of speakers because he comprehends all phenomena.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i bde ba'i ngo bo'i phyir mchog gi gnas so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i bde ba'i ngo bo'i phyir mchog gi gnas so //
translated: He is the supreme abode because he experiences the essence of bliss, the connate bliss.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ye shes kyi khams spros pas sna tshogs kyi don byed pa'i phyir smra ba'i seng ge'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ye shes kyi khams spros pas sna tshogs kyi don byed pa'i phyir smra ba'i seng ge'o //
translated: He is the lion of speech because he performs the various functions of the connate element of wisdom through elaboration.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems thams cad gcig tu gyur pas byang chub kyi sems mi 'dzag pa nyid kyis gzhan rnam par rtog pa'i rlabs kyis pham ba mi nus pas na chugs  pa med do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems thams cad gcig tu gyur pas byang chub kyi sems mi 'dzag pa nyid kyis gzhan rnam par rtog pa'i rlabs kyis pham ba mi nus pas na chugs  pa med do //
translated: Since the body, speech, and mind all become one, the bodhicitta is undissipating, and so it is not overcome by the waves of other conceptualizations.

original: yang snga ma phyed kyis rgyu nyid gsungs la /
analyzed: yang snga ma phyed kyis rgyu nyid gsungs la /
translated: The first half of the verse states the cause,

original: phyi ma phyed kyis dga' ba bzhi'i ngo bo 'bras bu gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi ma phyed kyis dga' ba bzhi'i ngo bo 'bras bu gsungs so //
translated: and the second half states the result, the nature of the four joys.

original: kun nas gzigs pa'i dang tshul gang gi yin pa'i ni kun du lta ba ste kun du bzang po'i gzugs kyis de'i ye shes thob pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas gzigs pa'i dang tshul gang gi yin pa'i ni kun du lta ba ste kun du bzang po'i gzugs kyis de'i ye shes thob pa ste /
translated: The one who has the mode of seeing all is Samantabhadra. His gnosis is obtained by means of the form of Samantabhadra.

original: chags pas 'dul ba'i sems can la ltos pas chos kyi dbyings gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis chags pa chen po'i rgyud spro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pas 'dul ba'i sems can la ltos pas chos kyi dbyings gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis chags pa chen po'i rgyud spro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, in dependence on the sentient beings to be tamed by passion, the tantra of great passion is emanated by means of the mode of the nondual dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: bde ba chen po 'dzin pa nyid kyis mchog tu dga' ba thob pa'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po 'dzin pa nyid kyis mchog tu dga' ba thob pa'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Since the supreme joy is obtained by means of the retention of great bliss, it is supreme joy.üîΩThe garland of splendor is the innate ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´.

original: gzhi brjid phreng ba lhan skyes kyi gtum mo'o 'od kyi rgyun no //
analyzed: gzhi brjid phreng ba lhan skyes kyi gtum mo'o 'od kyi rgyun no //
translated: The stream of light is the stream of light.

original: de'i bdag nyid du /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du /
translated: In the nature of that,

original: de dang ldan pas gzi brjid phreng ldan no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas gzi brjid phreng ldan no //
translated: endowed with that, is the garland of splendor.

original: blta na sdug pa lhan skyes kyi bde bam ngon sum du byed pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: blta na sdug pa lhan skyes kyi bde bam ngon sum du byed pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: That which has the innate bliss of beauty is just that.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang ba'i phyir ye shes kyi rgya mtsho'i zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang ba'i phyir ye shes kyi rgya mtsho'i zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the ‚Äúocean of intuition‚Äù is that it is filled with the nectar of the intuition of great bliss, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'od bzang po lhan skyes kyi ye shes 'phro ba'i bdag nyid gang gi yin ba de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'od bzang po lhan skyes kyi ye shes 'phro ba'i bdag nyid gang gi yin ba de de bzhin no //
translated: That which has the nature of the radiation of innate intuition is just that.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i snang ba byed pa'i phyir 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i snang ba byed pa'i phyir 'bar ba'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúblazing‚Äù because it illuminates the appearances of the buddhas and so forth residing in infinite world systems.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag skyed par byed pa gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa bon bkrun  par gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal gyi be'u'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag skyed par byed pa gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa bon bkrun  par gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal gyi be'u'o //
translated: It is the ‚Äúcleft of glory‚Äù because it has the characteristics of the TathƒÅgata, which is the seed of omniscience, the producer of all beings, the uncommon, the planted seed of the nectar of the intuition of great bliss, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: lag na 'od bar ba 'od kyi phung po'i gzugs gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo'o //
analyzed: lag na 'od bar ba 'od kyi phung po'i gzugs gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo'o //
translated: The light-handed one is the form of a mass of light, such as Yamantaka, the wrathful one.

original: de spro ba'i tshul gyis snang ba po ste khro bo des gdul ba'i sems can la snang ba po gang yin pa de'o //üîΩchags pa dang chags bral la @76a * //
analyzed: de spro ba'i tshul gyis snang ba po ste khro bo des gdul ba'i sems can la snang ba po gang yin pa de'o // chags pa dang chags bral la @76a * //
translated: The one who appears by the method of emanating that is the wrathful one who appears to the sentient beings to be subdued.

original: sogs pa'i nang thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir sman pa che'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i nang thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir sman pa che'o //
translated: The great physician is the one who destroys all the internal attachments, such as attachment and non-attachment.

original: mchog ni phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams pa'i sman ster ba po'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams pa'i sman ster ba po'o //
translated: The supreme one is the one who bestows the medicine of unmistaken instruction.

original: bdag nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin la gzhan rnams sbyor bas gtso bo'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin la gzhan rnams sbyor bas gtso bo'o //
translated: The chief one is the one who joins others to the nature of one's own great bliss.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rlung zug rdu thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir zug rdu 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rlung zug rdu thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir zug rdu 'byin pa'o //
translated: The one who extracts the thorns is the one who destroys all the thorns of the winds of discursive thought.

original: brjod du med pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir bla na med do //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir bla na med do //
translated: The unsurpassed one is the one who is of the nature of inexpressible bliss.

original: dpag bsam gyi ljon shing bzhin du rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'gro ba rjes su 'dzin pa 'phro ba'i phyir sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing ngo //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi ljon shing bzhin du rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'gro ba rjes su 'dzin pa 'phro ba'i phyir sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing ngo //
translated: It is the tree of all medicines, because it is the source of the medicine of the non-conceptual, which is like the wish-fulfilling tree, which nurtures the world.

original: nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba bde ba chen po'i rnam pa mngon sum du byed pa po nyid kyi phyir nad do cog chags pa dang chags bral la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgra che ba ste 'joms byed do
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba bde ba chen po'i rnam pa mngon sum du byed pa po nyid kyi phyir nad do cog chags pa dang chags bral la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgra che ba ste 'joms byed do
translated: It is the great enemy of all diseases, because it is the direct experience of the form of great bliss, which is the antidote to all afflictions, and which is naturally radiant.

original: // bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i ngo bo'i phyir mdzes pa sdu gu'o //
analyzed: // bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i ngo bo'i phyir mdzes pa sdu gu'o //
translated: It is beautiful, because it is the essence of self-consecration.

original: 'jig rten gsum lus ngag sems gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum lus ngag sems gcig pa nyid de /
translated: It is the one body, speech, and mind of the three worlds,

original: de'i mchog bde ba chen pos brgyan pa nyid kyis thig le'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gsum gyi mchog go //
analyzed: de'i mchog bde ba chen pos brgyan pa nyid kyis thig le'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gsum gyi mchog go //
translated: and it is the best of the three worlds, because it is the essence of the bindu, which is adorned with the supreme bliss.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i dngos grub kyi dpal dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i dngos grub kyi dpal dang ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: It is glorious, because it possesses the glory of the ultimate attainment, which is non-dual by nature.

original: rang gis rig par bya ba gsal ba bde ba chen po nyid kyi nam mkhar rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor bzhin du 'pho ba'i phyir rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can no //
analyzed: rang gis rig par bya ba gsal ba bde ba chen po nyid kyi nam mkhar rgyu skar gyi dkyil 'khor bzhin du 'pho ba'i phyir rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can no //
translated: It is the ‚Äúconstellation mandala‚Äù because it moves in the space of great bliss, which is the clarity that is to be cognized by oneself, like the mandala of the stars.

original: yang na gtsug tor du bzhi dang dpral bar bcu drug ste /
analyzed: yang na gtsug tor du bzhi dang dpral bar bcu drug ste /
translated: Or, the four are in the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a and the sixteen are in the forehead.

original: rtsa nyi shu po 'di dag ni bad kan gyi khams rab tu 'khrug pa po'o //üîΩmgrin par sum cu rtsa gnyis dang snying gar brgyad de rtsa bzhi bcu po 'di dag mkhris pa'i khams 'khrug pa po'o //
analyzed: rtsa nyi shu po 'di dag ni bad kan gyi khams rab tu 'khrug pa po'o // mgrin par sum cu rtsa gnyis dang snying gar brgyad de rtsa bzhi bcu po 'di dag mkhris pa'i khams 'khrug pa po'o //
translated: These twenty nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s disturb the phlegm element.üîΩThe thirty-two are in the throat and the eight are in the heart. These forty nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s disturb the bile element.

original: lte bar rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi dang gsang ba'i padma'i phyi rol yongs su bskor ba bcu drug ste rtsa brgyad cu po 'di dag rlung gi khams 'khrug pa po'o //
analyzed: lte bar rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi dang gsang ba'i padma'i phyi rol yongs su bskor ba bcu drug ste rtsa brgyad cu po 'di dag rlung gi khams 'khrug pa po'o //
translated: The sixty-four nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s are in the navel and the sixteen are outside the secret lotus. These eighty nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s disturb the wind element.

original: 'di nyid kyi bar gyi yongs su 'khor ba bcu dang / dbus kyi dkyil 'khor du drug ni grangs ji lta bar 'dus pa dang 'dus pa rab tu 'khrug par byed pa dang 'khor lo drug 'gog pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bar gyi yongs su 'khor ba bcu dang / dbus kyi dkyil 'khor du drug ni grangs ji lta bar 'dus pa dang 'dus pa rab tu 'khrug par byed pa dang 'khor lo drug 'gog pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The ten complete cycles up to this point, and the six in the central mandala, are the natures of the six wheels, which are just the same in number as the six gatherings and the six thoroughly disturbing gatherings.

original: 'di ltar rtsa brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug po rnams byis pa rnams la 'chi ba ster ba po ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la bde ba ster ba po ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsa brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug po rnams byis pa rnams la 'chi ba ster ba po ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la bde ba ster ba po ste /
translated: Thus, the one hundred and fifty-six channels that give death to the childish give bliss to the yogis.

original: rigs drug gi rtsa dang bcas pas rtsa brgya drug cu @76b rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: rigs drug gi rtsa dang bcas pas rtsa brgya drug cu @76b rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Together with the channels of the six families, there are one hundred and sixty-two channels.

original: rtsa 'di rnams su yang rlung bcu rgyu bas phung po dang khams bcu'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa re re yang rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa 'di rnams su yang rlung bcu rgyu bas phung po dang khams bcu'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa re re yang rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the ten winds move in these channels, each channel, which has the nature of the ten aggregates and constituents, has ten aspects.

original: de ltar bcus bsgyur pas stong drug brgya nyi shur 'gyur te rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun gyi chu tshod 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcus bsgyur pas stong drug brgya nyi shur 'gyur te rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun gyi chu tshod 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Thus, multiplied by ten, there are one thousand six hundred twenty. They hold the twenty-seven-part hours.

original: de dag 'gags pa'i phyir dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can no //
analyzed: de dag 'gags pa'i phyir dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can no //
translated: Since they are blocked, they are the glorious mandala of the lunar mansions.

original: phyogs bcu'i nam mkhar 'od gsal nyid de de'i mthar thug pa gsal ba'i dngos po ste don dam pa'i thig le'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i nam mkhar 'od gsal nyid de de'i mthar thug pa gsal ba'i dngos po ste don dam pa'i thig le'i ngo bo'o //
translated: That itself is the ultimate reality of the bindu of ultimate reality.

original: de nyid tshangs pa'i gnas su son pa nyid kyis chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid tshangs pa'i gnas su son pa nyid kyis chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: Since it has reached the state of BrahmƒÅ, it is the one who properly raises the victory banner of Dharma.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba mtha' dag sel ba nyid kyis lus dang ngag sems gcig tu 'dres pa'i ngo bo 'gro ba nyid gdugs te rgyun chad med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rgyun gyis gtad pa'i gtum mo'i gser gyi dbyug pas bteg ste 'dzin pa nyid kyi gtsug
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba mtha' dag sel ba nyid kyis lus dang ngag sems gcig tu 'dres pa'i ngo bo 'gro ba nyid gdugs te rgyun chad med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rgyun gyis gtad pa'i gtum mo'i gser gyi dbyug pas bteg ste 'dzin pa nyid kyi gtsug
translated: Since it removes all the heat of the afflictions, it is the parasol that holds the continuum of great bliss without interruption through the essence of the body, voice, and mind combined as one.

original: tor du son pa ba spu'i khung bu'i mthar thug par son pa nyid kyis yangs pa rgya che ba gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: tor du son pa ba spu'i khung bu'i mthar thug par son pa nyid kyis yangs pa rgya che ba gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: Since it reaches the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a at the end of the pores, it is vast and extensive.

original: 'od kyi mthus byams pa dang byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis snying rje'o //
analyzed: 'od kyi mthus byams pa dang byang chub kyi sems nyid kyis snying rje'o //
translated: Through the power of light, it is love. Through the mind of awakening, it is compassion.

original: de gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor snying po len pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor snying po len pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: The essence of the ma·πá·∏çala of those two is just that.

original: brjod du med pa'i bde ba byang chub kyi sems kyi phyir padma gar gyi bdag po rdo rje padma bskyod pa'i khyab bdag ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bde ba byang chub kyi sems kyi phyir padma gar gyi bdag po rdo rje padma bskyod pa'i khyab bdag ces pa'i don to //
translated: For the sake of the inexpressible bliss of bodhicitta, he is Padmanarte≈õvara, the lord of the ma·πá·∏çala, the lord of the vajra lotus.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: For that very reason, he is glorious.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo'i phyir khyab bdag chen po'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo'i phyir khyab bdag chen po'o //
translated: He is the great lord because he is the nature of all things.

original: gtum mo 'bar ba'i sbyor bas rdo rje rin po che chen po'i rtse mor gnas nas rnam par rtog pa'i gdung ba mtha' dag nye bar 'gog pa'i phyir dang / lus thams cad bsil bar byed pa'i phyir gdugs dang 'dra bas gdugs te rin chen gdugs so //
analyzed: gtum mo 'bar ba'i sbyor bas rdo rje rin po che chen po'i rtse mor gnas nas rnam par rtog pa'i gdung ba mtha' dag nye bar 'gog pa'i phyir dang / lus thams cad bsil bar byed pa'i phyir gdugs dang 'dra bas gdugs te rin chen gdugs so //
translated: Since he abides at the tip of the great vajra jewel through the practice of blazing ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´, he is the sun because he is like a parasol that completely stops the torment of conceptuality and cools the entire body.

original: sangs rgyas kun rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rgyal po rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rgyal po rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: He is the king of all buddhas, such as Vairocana, because he is the nature of vajra mind, bodhicitta.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid chos thams cad stong pa nyid de kho na dngos po mchog gi ngo bo de 'dzin pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid chos thams cad stong pa nyid de kho na dngos po mchog gi ngo bo de 'dzin pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the supreme entity is just that, the emptiness of all phenomena, the identity of all buddhas.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying por gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi rnal 'byor che ste mchog tu bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying por gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi rnal 'byor che ste mchog tu bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: It is just so, because the nature of the aggregates and so on is the abode of the essence of all tathƒÅgatas. It is the great yoga of all buddhas, the nature of the samƒÅdhi of supreme great bliss.

original: phung @77a * //
analyzed: phung @77a * //
translated: The aggregates,

original: po dang khams la sogs pa sangs rgyas kun gyi bstan pa bde ba nyid du rdzogs par byed pa gcig nyid yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: po dang khams la sogs pa sangs rgyas kun gyi bstan pa bde ba nyid du rdzogs par byed pa gcig nyid yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: elements, and so on are the sole perfection of the teaching of all buddhas in the state of bliss.

original: rdo rje rin chen dbang bskur lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen dbang bskur lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: It is just so. The vajra jewel is the bliss of connate joy.

original: de nyid dpal te bcom ldan 'das ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dpal te bcom ldan 'das ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is glorious, because the BhagavƒÅn is the nature of that.

original: rin chen kun bdag sangs rgyas kyi dbang phyug chen po ste spyi bor 'chang ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rin chen kun bdag sangs rgyas kyi dbang phyug chen po ste spyi bor 'chang ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The lord of all jewels is the great lord of buddhas, because he is held on the crown.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug kun sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' kun gyi dbang phyug rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug kun sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' kun gyi dbang phyug rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The Lord of the World is the universal Buddha, and the Lord of all the Bodhisattvas is Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid bdag po ste /
analyzed: de nyid bdag po ste /
translated: He is the Lord,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of being the nature of all things.

original: lus la sogs pa'i thig le gsum 'chang ba ste rdo rje 'chang ba kun no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i thig le gsum 'chang ba ste rdo rje 'chang ba kun no //
translated: He is the bearer of all the vajras, because he bears the three bindus of body, etc.

original: de rnams kyi rje bo stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i thig le bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rje bo stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i thig le bzhi pa'o //
translated: He is the Lord of those, because of being the fourth bindu of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs kun nas mnar sems med pa nyid kyis thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs kun nas mnar sems med pa nyid kyis thugs rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir de bzhin no //
translated: He is so, because of being the nature of great compassion, by the absence of malice in the mind of all the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la sems med pa'i sems gnas pa thim pa de'i bdag nyid du gang gi yin pa de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la sems med pa'i sems gnas pa thim pa de'i bdag nyid du gang gi yin pa de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: He is so described, because of being the one whose mind, the mind without mind, abides in the mind of all the Buddhas, dissolved into its own nature.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i ye shes kyi sku'i nyid kyi chos thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi sku che ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i ye shes kyi sku'i nyid kyi chos thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi sku che ba'o //
translated: It is the great body of all the Buddhas, because it pervades all things as the essence of the body of intuition which is the reality realm.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsi rab tu 'bab par thim pa'i gzhi bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chu bo'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsi rab tu 'bab par thim pa'i gzhi bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chu bo'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin /
translated: It is the speech of all the Buddhas, because it is the nature of the river of inconceivable nectar of great bliss, the basis of the descent of the nectar of the great bliss of the body, speech, and mind of all the Buddhas.

original: rtags bzlog pa ni gtsug lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags bzlog pa ni gtsug lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reversal of the sign is the scripture.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung gi bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bde ba'i chu bo gang gi yin pa de thams cad de bzhin du 'thung ba nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung gi bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bde ba'i chu bo gang gi yin pa de thams cad de bzhin du 'thung ba nyid do //
translated: It is the drinking of all that, because it is the river of the inconceivable bliss which is the nature of the speech of all the Buddhas.

original: rdo rje nyi ma ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snang ba chen po khams gsum po mtha' dag snang ba nor bu'i lte ba'i nang du gnas pa'i sems kyi skad cig gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi snang ba chen po khams gsum po mtha' dag snang ba nor bu'i lte ba'i nang du gnas pa'i sems kyi skad cig gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che'o //
translated: The great appearance of the sun of the vajra, the ma·πá·∏çala of intuition, is the characteristic of the instant of mind that abides in the center of the jewel, the appearance of the entire triple world. That is the great appearance of the sun of the vajra.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rdo rje nyi ma'ang gang zhig sems //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'ang gang zhig sems //
translated: The sun of the vajra is the mind

original: nor bu'i nang du son par blta //
analyzed: nor bu'i nang du son par blta //
translated: that is seen to have entered the jewel.

original: ye shes dkyil 'khor rnam pa yis //
analyzed: ye shes dkyil 'khor rnam pa yis //
translated: By the form of the ma·πá·∏çala of intuition,

original: khams gsum po dag snang ba nyid //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: khams gsum po dag snang ba nyid // ces gsungs so //
translated: the triple world is illuminated.

original: mthar lhun gyis grub pas gnyis su med pa'i sems shes pa'o //
analyzed: mthar lhun gyis grub pas gnyis su med pa'i sems shes pa'o //
translated: In the end, the nondual mind is known by spontaneous accomplishment.

original: rdo rje zla ba ye shes kyi zla ba bzang po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zla ba ye shes kyi zla ba bzang po'o //
translated: The moon of the vajra is the good moon of intuition.

original: de dri ma med pa rnam @77b par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de dri ma med pa rnam @77b par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa'o //
translated: That is stainless, having abandoned all conceptualization.

original: 'od 'jig rten gsum du snang ba gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'od 'jig rten gsum du snang ba gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The light that illuminates the three worlds is just that.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyi nyi ma dang zla ba dang sgra gcan dang me dang rdul dang khu ba dang sems dang ye shes gcig pa'i sbyor ba gsum po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyi nyi ma dang zla ba dang sgra gcan dang me dang rdul dang khu ba dang sems dang ye shes gcig pa'i sbyor ba gsum po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the two lines is: the three yogas of the sun, moon, RƒÅhu, fire, dust, semen, mind, and gnosis as one.

original: chags bral 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sogs pa chags pa chen po lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag nyid bzhi pa de'i bdag nyid du gang gi yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: chags bral 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sogs pa chags pa chen po lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag nyid bzhi pa de'i bdag nyid du gang gi yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: The fourth is like that, which has the nature of the great passion of the innate, the nature of which is the characteristic of being free from passion.

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa kha dog du ma'i 'bar ba rnam par rtog pa 'jigs pa 'joms pa'i 'od gang yin pa de kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od do //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa kha dog du ma'i 'bar ba rnam par rtog pa 'jigs pa 'joms pa'i 'od gang yin pa de kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od do //
translated: The light of the blazing of various colors, the many-colored blazing light, is the light that conquers the fear of conceptuality.

original: 'di yang bla ma'i zhal nas so //
analyzed: 'di yang bla ma'i zhal nas so //
translated: This also is from the guru‚Äôs instruction.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩsku mthong nas ni nyi ma re re'i dus su srog gi rlung dag dgag pa rab tu bya //
analyzed: de skad du yang / sku mthong nas ni nyi ma re re'i dus su srog gi rlung dag dgag pa rab tu bya //
translated: And it is said:üîΩHaving seen the body, one should block the life vƒÅyu every day.

original: ji srid nges par 'khor bzhin rang gi lus la yongs 'khor 'od zer 'khor lo mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji srid nges par 'khor bzhin rang gi lus la yongs 'khor 'od zer 'khor lo mthong bar 'gyur //
