translated: And so on.üîΩArisen from the clear light, he holds the five pure aggregates, which are naturally clear light.

original: 'od gsal la las bzhengs pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du rnam par dag pa'i phung po lnga 'chang bas na rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba'o //üîΩdes 'byung kun gyi mtha' zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'od gsal la las bzhengs pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du rnam par dag pa'i phung po lnga 'chang bas na rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba'o // des 'byung kun gyi mtha' zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
translated: Thus, he is the holder of the five pure aggregates.

original: brjod du med pa bdag med pa'i bde ba rtogs pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa bdag med pa'i bde ba rtogs pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas so //
translated: He is skilled in all the paths of renunciation because he realizes the inexpressible bliss of selflessness.

original: bde ba chen po rin po che nyid kyis chags pa med kyang /
analyzed: bde ba chen po rin po che nyid kyis chags pa med kyang /
translated: Although he is free from attachment by the very nature of the great bliss jewel,

original: thugs rje chen po'i stobs kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam @83b la gnas pa'i phyir nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas so //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i stobs kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam @83b la gnas pa'i phyir nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas so //
translated: he abides on the path of all the vehicles of renunciation by the power of great compassion, abiding on the path of the hearers and so on.

original: bde ba chen po'i sku'i chos su chos kyi dbyings nges par 'byung ba kun no //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i sku'i chos su chos kyi dbyings nges par 'byung ba kun no //
translated: The great bliss body is the Dharma, and the realm of reality is the Dharma that is to be attained.

original: de ston pa rnam par rtog pa med pas ston pa po'o //
analyzed: de ston pa rnam par rtog pa med pas ston pa po'o //
translated: The teacher is the one who teaches without conceptualization.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pas sam /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pas sam /
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination, such as ignorance, are stopped.

original: gnas dang / nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas bde ba chen po nyid kyis yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton no //
analyzed: gnas dang / nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas bde ba chen po nyid kyis yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton no //
translated: The twelve links are the root of existence, which is extracted by the great bliss of the places, such as the place and the nearby place.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gzhan gyi gnas ni shes rab la //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnas ni shes rab la //
translated: The other place is said to be wisdom.

original: bdag nyid gnas ni thabs su brjod //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas ni thabs su brjod //
translated: The own place is said to be method.

original: 'di dag gnyis med dngos po ni //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyis med dngos po ni //
translated: The nondual entity of these two

original: rnal 'byor gnas zhes bya bar gnas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gnas zhes bya bar gnas //
translated: is said to be the place of yoga.

original: de nyid gnas ni de las skyes //
analyzed: de nyid gnas ni de las skyes //
translated: That very place is born from that.

original: de dang bral bar gang gyur pa //
analyzed: de dang bral bar gang gyur pa //
translated: That which becomes free from that

original: lhan skyes zhes ni mnyam par grags //üîΩngag gi lam 'das spyod yul lo //
analyzed: lhan skyes zhes ni mnyam par grags // ngag gi lam 'das spyod yul lo //
translated: is said to be the equal connate.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is beyond the path of speech and the domain of experience.

original: gzhan du gnas ni bud med gsang ba'i padma dam tshig dag tu rdo rje kho na nye ba'i gnas su 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du gnas ni bud med gsang ba'i padma dam tshig dag tu rdo rje kho na nye ba'i gnas su 'gyur //
translated: Elsewhere, the place is the secret lotus of a woman, and the vajra is the nearby place in the pledge.

original: zhing dang bdun pa dag dang 'dus pa ro bsregs sa gzhi de bzhin 'di ltar mtha' dag gi / yan lag g-yon dang shar ni gnas te gzhan pa de bzhin g-yas pa dag ni nye ba'i gnas //üîΩde ltar zhing sogs thams cad lag pa rkang par gnas pa'i sor mo'i mtshams la thugs par ro ;
analyzed: zhing dang bdun pa dag dang 'dus pa ro bsregs sa gzhi de bzhin 'di ltar mtha' dag gi / yan lag g-yon dang shar ni gnas te gzhan pa de bzhin g-yas pa dag ni nye ba'i gnas // de ltar zhing sogs thams cad lag pa rkang par gnas pa'i sor mo'i mtshams la thugs par ro ;
translated: The left and the east are the limbs, and the right is the subsidiary limbs.

original: / zhes so //
analyzed: / zhes so //
translated: Thus, all the fields and so on are located in the fingers and toes.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas dben pa'i skye mched bcu gnyis 'chang ba'i phyir dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas dben pa'i skye mched bcu gnyis 'chang ba'i phyir dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ngo //
translated: He holds the twelve pure aspects because he holds the twelve sense bases, which are empty of the aspects of object and subject.

original: tha mal pa'i brtags pa'i bde ba sdug bsngal dang / bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du son pa'i lus ngag sems kyi rang bzhin 'gog pa dang / dmigs pa dang bral ba rang gi sems kyi snang ba la 'gro ba sangs rgyas kyi skur mthong ba'i lam ste 'di dag thams cad gnyis su med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa can gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i brtags pa'i bde ba sdug bsngal dang / bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du son pa'i lus ngag sems kyi rang bzhin 'gog pa dang / dmigs pa dang bral ba rang gi sems kyi snang ba la 'gro ba sangs rgyas kyi skur mthong ba'i lam ste 'di dag thams cad gnyis su med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa can gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The ordinary imagined pleasure and pain, the characteristic of the origin, the nature of body, speech, and mind that has entered into the ma·πá·∏çala of pristine consciousness is cessation, and the path is seeing the appearances of one‚Äôs mind free from reference points as the kƒÅya of a buddha.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi dang / rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i dga' ba chen po'i ye shes brgyad 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi dang / rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i dga' ba chen po'i ye shes brgyad 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang ngo //
translated: Since one holds the eight pristine consciousnesses of great joy, which are the four kinds of varieties and the four kinds of natural expressions, one holds the realization of the eight consciousnesses.

original: rgyu mthun dang / rnam par smin pa dang / skyes bu byed pa dang / dri bral gyi skad cig rnams re re zhing sum gyur las /
analyzed: rgyu mthun dang / rnam par smin pa dang / skyes bu byed pa dang / dri bral gyi skad cig rnams re re zhing sum gyur las /
translated: The moments of natural expression, ripening, function of a person, and freedom from taints are each tripled.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis pa bcu gnyis kun rdzob dang don @84a * //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis pa bcu gnyis kun rdzob dang don @84a * //
translated: The twelve aspects are the twelve aspects of the relative and ultimate truths.

original: dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye bas de dang ldan pa'i phyir bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan no //
analyzed: dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye bas de dang ldan pa'i phyir bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan no //
translated: The one who possesses them is the one who possesses the twelve aspects of the meaning of the truths.

original: de la lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi dben pa'i rgyu mthun gyi dbye bas dang po gsum sprul pa'i sku'i'o //
analyzed: de la lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi dben pa'i rgyu mthun gyi dbye bas dang po gsum sprul pa'i sku'i'o //
translated: Among them, the first three are the emanation body, classified as the natural outflow of the isolation of body, speech, and mind.

original: snang ba dang / so sor snang ba dang / rang bzhin gyi snang ba med pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dbye bas gnyis pa gsum longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang / so sor snang ba dang / rang bzhin gyi snang ba med pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dbye bas gnyis pa gsum longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i'o //
translated: The second three are the enjoyment body, classified as the maturation of the absence of the appearance of appearance, individual appearance, and natural appearance.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / ma rig pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i rnam par smin pa'i dbye bas gsum pa gsum chos kyi sku'i'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / ma rig pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i rnam par smin pa'i dbye bas gsum pa gsum chos kyi sku'i'o //
translated: The third three are the truth body, classified as the maturation of the absence of the stains of mind, mental factors, and ignorance.

original: dga' ba gnyis dang / khyad par dang / lhan skyes kyi dga' ba dri bral gyi dbye bas bzhi pa gsum ye shes kyi sku'i'o //
analyzed: dga' ba gnyis dang / khyad par dang / lhan skyes kyi dga' ba dri bral gyi dbye bas bzhi pa gsum ye shes kyi sku'i'o //
translated: The fourth three are the gnosis body, classified as the absence of the stains of the two joys, special joy, and innate joy.

original: srog zad pas rdul 'gags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: srog zad pas rdul 'gags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because the life force is exhausted, the dust is blocked.

original: dga' ba bcu drug gi cha khu ba 'gags pas de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba bcu drug gi cha khu ba 'gags pas de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: Since the semen, which is the portion of the sixteen joys, is arrested, it is ‚Äújust so‚Äù that one knows the sixteen aspects.

original: lug dang glang la sogs pa'i khyim bcu gnyis 'gags pa nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: lug dang glang la sogs pa'i khyim bcu gnyis 'gags pa nyid kyis sam /
translated: Since the twelve houses of Aries, Taurus, and so on, are arrested,

original: sa bcu gnyis thob pa'i phyir bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan no //
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis thob pa'i phyir bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan no //
translated: or since the twelve stages are attained, it is endowed with the twelve aspects of the truth.

original: 'khor ba'i cha bcu drug zad pas sam /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i cha bcu drug zad pas sam /
translated: Since the sixteen aspects of sa·πÉsƒÅra are exhausted,

original: mi 'gyur pa'i phyir de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig go //
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa'i phyir de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig go //
translated: or since it is unchanging, it is ‚Äújust so‚Äù that one knows the sixteen aspects.

original: sbyor ba yan lag drug bsgoms pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa'i aa wa dh'u t'i sbyangs pa nyid kyis phung po lnga dang / khams lnga dang / dbang po lnga dang / skye mched lnga rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa khong du chud pa'i phyir rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba yan lag drug bsgoms pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa'i aa wa dh'u t'i sbyangs pa nyid kyis phung po lnga dang / khams lnga dang / dbang po lnga dang / skye mched lnga rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa khong du chud pa'i phyir rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa'o //
translated: Since one comprehends the twenty aspects of the purification of the five aggregates, five elements, five sense organs, and five sense objects through the purification of the central channel that is cultivated by the practice of the six-branched yoga, there is enlightenment with twenty aspects.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pa'i phyir rnam par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pa'i phyir rnam par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Since ignorance is arrested, there is complete buddhahood.

original: dngos po'i tshogs thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du rtog pas kun nas rig mchog go //
analyzed: dngos po'i tshogs thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du rtog pas kun nas rig mchog go //
translated: The supreme awareness is the realization that the entire collection of things is the nature of the Buddha.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa kun gcig tu gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku dpag tu med pa dngos po'i grong khyer rlung gi tshogs kyi bde ba chen po nyid du skad cig gcig la 'gyed pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa kun gcig tu gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku dpag tu med pa dngos po'i grong khyer rlung gi tshogs kyi bde ba chen po nyid du skad cig gcig la 'gyed pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
translated: It is so because the nirmanakaya of the Buddha, which is the unity of all nirvanas, emanates in an instant into the great bliss of the city of things, the collection of winds, which is immeasurable.

original: 'dis ni mtshan ma med pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan ma med pa gsungs so //
translated: This verse teaches the signless.

original: rlung thams cad kyi rlung re re zhing bde ba chen por bsgyur pas skad cig thams cad mngon rtogs so //
analyzed: rlung thams cad kyi rlung re re zhing bde ba chen por bsgyur pas skad cig thams cad mngon rtogs so //
translated: Every wind is transformed into the great bliss, and every instant is the realization of the goal.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi skad cig rnam pa chen po nyid du rig pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi skad cig rnam pa chen po nyid du rig pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
translated: It is so because the great aspect of every instant of the mind of all sentient beings is known.

original: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul yan lag bzhi dang / yan lag drug dang / thig le'i sbyor ba la sogs pas 'gro ba'i don la bde ba chen po nyid du rtogs par @84b byed 'phro bar byed pas na de bzhin no //
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul yan lag bzhi dang / yan lag drug dang / thig le'i sbyor ba la sogs pas 'gro ba'i don la bde ba chen po nyid du rtogs par @84b byed 'phro bar byed pas na de bzhin no //
translated: Since it causes the realization and the emission of the great bliss itself for the sake of migrating beings by means of the various vehicles, the four branches of means and modes, the six branches, the yoga of the bindu, and so on, it is thus.

original: ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi lus ngag sems nges par 'byung ba'i phyir theg pa gsum gyi nges 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi lus ngag sems nges par 'byung ba'i phyir theg pa gsum gyi nges 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since the body, speech, and mind of the j√±anakƒÅya definitely emerge, it is the emergence of the three vehicles.

original: theg pa gcig gnyis pa med pa 'bras bu ha'i rnam pa ste der gnas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gcig gnyis pa med pa 'bras bu ha'i rnam pa ste der gnas pa'o //
translated: Since there is no second vehicle, it is the single vehicle, the aspect of the result.

original: ma rig pa rnam par nyams pa'i phyir khams rnams dag pa'i bdag nyid gang gi yin pa de nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: ma rig pa rnam par nyams pa'i phyir khams rnams dag pa'i bdag nyid gang gi yin pa de nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag go //
translated: Since the elements are purified, it is the self of the pure element of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i khams de yang bco brgyad de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i khams de yang bco brgyad de /
translated: That element of afflictions is also eighteen.

original: rus pa dang / pags dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa dang / rkang mar dang / tshil dang / khu ba dang / bad kan dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / mcher pa dang /üîΩmchin pa dang / rnag ma dang / dri ma dang / ba spu zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: rus pa dang / pags dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa dang / rkang mar dang / tshil dang / khu ba dang / bad kan dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / mcher pa dang / mchin pa dang / rnag ma dang / dri ma dang / ba spu zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: spleen, pus, dirt, and body hair.

original: bsod nams dang sdig pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang sdig pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa'o //
translated: The elements of action are exhausted because of the absence of the concepts of merit and sin.

original: rang bzhin thams cad 'gags pas ye shes kyi pha rol tu son pa'i phyir chu bo'i rgya mtsho kun las rgal lo //
analyzed: rang bzhin thams cad 'gags pas ye shes kyi pha rol tu son pa'i phyir chu bo'i rgya mtsho kun las rgal lo //
translated: The ocean of the rivers is crossed because of the cessation of all natures and the attainment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rang bzhen de yang chags bral dang chags bral 'bring po dang / shin tu chags bral dang / yid gang yin pa dang / 'gro 'od dang / mya ngan dang / mya ngan 'bring po dang / shin tu mya ngan dang / zhi ba dang /
analyzed: rang bzhen de yang chags bral dang chags bral 'bring po dang / shin tu chags bral dang / yid gang yin pa dang / 'gro 'od dang / mya ngan dang / mya ngan 'bring po dang / shin tu mya ngan dang / zhi ba dang /
translated: That nature is freedom from attachment, middling freedom from attachment, and complete freedom from attachment, the mind, going, sorrow, middling sorrow, great sorrow, and peace.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / sred pa dang / bar ma'i sred pa dang / shin tu sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / dge bral dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tshor ba dang / mnyam pa'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / sred pa dang / bar ma'i sred pa dang / shin tu sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / dge bral dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tshor ba dang / mnyam pa'i tshor ba dang /
translated: conceptualization, fear, craving, middling craving, intense craving, appropriation, separation from virtue, hunger, thirst, sensation, equal sensation,

original: shin tu tshor ba dang / rig byed rig pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gnas dang / so sor rtog pa dang / ngo tsha dang / snying rje dang / byams pa dang / byams pa 'bring po dang / shin tu byams pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu tshor ba dang / rig byed rig pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gnas dang / so sor rtog pa dang / ngo tsha dang / snying rje dang / byams pa dang / byams pa 'bring po dang / shin tu byams pa dang /
translated: intense sensation, awareness of awareness, grasping, abode, discernment, shame, compassion, love, middling love, intense love,

original: tshim pa dang / bsags pa dang / ser sna ste sum cu rtsa gsum gyi skad cig ma rnams shes rab ye shes kyi'o //
analyzed: tshim pa dang / bsags pa dang / ser sna ste sum cu rtsa gsum gyi skad cig ma rnams shes rab ye shes kyi'o //
translated: satisfaction, accumulation, and miserliness. These thirty-three moments are of the gnosis of wisdom.

original: 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / mgu ba dang / mgu ba 'bring po dang / shin tu mgu ba dang / dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / ngo mtshar dang / dgod pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / 'o dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / mgu ba dang / mgu ba 'bring po dang / shin tu mgu ba dang / dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / ngo mtshar dang / dgod pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / 'o dang /
translated: Attachment, passion, delight, middling delight, intense delight, joy, intense joy, wonder, laughter, embrace, kiss,

original: gzhib pa dang / brtan po dang / brtson 'grus dang / nga rgyal dang / byed pa dang / 'phrog pa dang / stobs dang / spro ba dang / @85a * //üîΩgya tshom 'brid po dang / gya tshom mchog dang / drag shul dang / sgeg pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / dge ba dang / ngag gsal ba dang / bden pa dang / nges pa dang / nyer len med pa sbyin pa po nyid bskul ba dang /
analyzed: gzhib pa dang / brtan po dang / brtson 'grus dang / nga rgyal dang / byed pa dang / 'phrog pa dang / stobs dang / spro ba dang / @85a * // gya tshom 'brid po dang / gya tshom mchog dang / drag shul dang / sgeg pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / dge ba dang / ngag gsal ba dang / bden pa dang / nges pa dang / nyer len med pa sbyin pa po nyid bskul ba dang /
translated: the one who is firm, the one who is diligent, the one who is proud, the one who acts, the one who takes away, the one who is powerful, the one who is delighted, the one who is confused, the one who is deceitful, the one who is supreme, the one who is violent, the one who is charming, the one who is resentful, the one who is virtuous, the one who is clear-spoken, the one who is truthful, the one who is certain, the one who is not attached, the one who is a generous instigator,

original: dpa' ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khram nyid dang / ma rungs pa dang / g-yo dang / 'khyog pa ste skad cig ma bzhi bcu po rnams thabs kyi ye shes kyi'o //
analyzed: dpa' ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khram nyid dang / ma rungs pa dang / g-yo dang / 'khyog pa ste skad cig ma bzhi bcu po rnams thabs kyi ye shes kyi'o //
translated: the one who is heroic, the one who is shameless, the one who is deceitful, the one who is wicked, the one who is crooked, and the one who is momentary.

original: 'dod chags 'bring po dang / brjed ngas dang / 'khrul pa dang / cang mi smra ba dang / ngal ba dang / le lo dang / blun pa nyid de skad cig ma bdun po snang ba thob pa'i ye shes kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'bring po dang / brjed ngas dang / 'khrul pa dang / cang mi smra ba dang / ngal ba dang / le lo dang / blun pa nyid de skad cig ma bdun po snang ba thob pa'i ye shes kyi'o //
translated: The seven moments are the one who is of middling passion, the one who is forgetful, the one who is deluded, the one who is silent, the one who is weary, the one who is lazy, and the one who is foolish.

original: 'di rnams kyang nyin mo ngang mtshan mor gnas pa'i brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang nyin mo ngang mtshan mor gnas pa'i brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
translated: These are also one hundred and sixty, since they are during the day and night.

original: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag bzod pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag bzod pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Because of the forbearance of all conceptual thoughts, it is the emergence from the wilderness of practice.

original: sbyor ba ye shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa tsam ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ye shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa tsam ste /
translated: The practice is the mere meditative concentration of the wisdom of the six-branched yoga.

original: dgon pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgon pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a wilderness because it is difficult to realize.

original: nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs ma rig pa la sogs pa bag chags dang bcas pa gtan spangs pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //üîΩsbyor ba yan lag drug gis bsgrubs pa'i phyag rgya chen po shes rab ste de dang gnyis su med par gyur pa'i snying rje chen po des don yod bcing du med cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs ma rig pa la sogs pa bag chags dang bcas pa gtan spangs pa gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no // sbyor ba yan lag drug gis bsgrubs pa'i phyag rgya chen po shes rab ste de dang gnyis su med par gyur pa'i snying rje chen po des don yod bcing du med cing /
translated: It is just so, because it is the complete abandonment of the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, and the predispositions of ignorance and so forth.

original: gzhom du med pa'i bde ba 'gro ba'i don byed pas na de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhom du med pa'i bde ba 'gro ba'i don byed pas na de bzhin no //
translated: The practice is the great seal of wisdom, which is accomplished by the six-branched yoga. It is just so, because it is the great compassion that is nondual with that, which acts for the welfare of beings with the unbreakable, unbindable, and undefeatable bliss.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa'i phyir 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing ngo //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa'i phyir 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing ngo //
translated: It is just so, because it is the abandonment of the object of all discriminations, since there is also no discrimination of meditative concentration and so forth.

original: rnam shes 'dzin pa dang bral ba don phyi rol yang ste gang gi yin ba de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam shes 'dzin pa dang bral ba don phyi rol yang ste gang gi yin ba de de bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúfree from the grasping of consciousness‚Äù is that it is external.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnas med pa'i chos nyid tsam gyi phyir 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnas med pa'i chos nyid tsam gyi phyir 'gog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is stopped by the mere non-existence of a basis.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yid rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor bas yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir sems can kun yid yul dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yid rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor bas yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir sems can kun yid yul dang ldan no //
translated: The minds of all sentient beings are endowed with objects, because they arise from the non-conceptual application of all sentient beings.

original: yang na yul ma yin pa spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na yul ma yin pa spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Or, it is not an object, not a domain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can kun gyi yid rig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can kun gyi yid rig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the minds of all sentient beings are aware.

original: sems can kun gyi yid nang du chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir gnas pa'i zhes pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid nang du chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir gnas pa'i zhes pa de bzhin no //
translated: The minds of all sentient beings are present, because the essence of the dharmadhƒÅtu appears internally.

original: sems can de dag gi sems dang mthun pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor 'jug pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems dang mthun pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor 'jug pa thob pa ste /
translated: They have attained the state of entering into suchness, which is in accord with the minds of those sentient beings.

original: thams cad ni chos nyid kyi ngo bor khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni chos nyid kyi ngo bor khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all are without distinction in the essence of reality.

original: @85b phyin ci log las bzlog pa nyid kyis bde ba chen po'i ye shes 'char ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @85b phyin ci log las bzlog pa nyid kyis bde ba chen po'i ye shes 'char ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the gnosis of great bliss arises by turning away from error,

original: sems can kun yid tshim par byed do //
analyzed: sems can kun yid tshim par byed do //
translated: it satisfies the minds of all sentient beings.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the delight of the minds of all sentient beings because it is the nature of the bliss of the undefiled.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba mchog tu mthar phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i mthar phyin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba mchog tu mthar phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i mthar phyin no //
translated: It has reached the culmination of attainment because it is the nature of the supreme, ultimate perfection, free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: gang zag la sogs par 'khrul pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: gang zag la sogs par 'khrul pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
translated: It is without error because it is free from error in regard to the person and so forth.

original: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs grub dang bral ba'i phyir nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs so //
analyzed: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs grub dang bral ba'i phyir nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs so //
translated: It is free from all error because it is free from the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: don gsum shes rab kyi don bsgrub bya bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi don gsum mo //
analyzed: don gsum shes rab kyi don bsgrub bya bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi don gsum mo //
translated: The meaning of the three objects is the three objects that are to be accomplished by the wisdom, which is the nature of bliss.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grub mtha' yongs su shes pas sems can rnams la de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa ston pa'i phyir the tshom med pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grub mtha' yongs su shes pas sems can rnams la de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa ston pa'i phyir the tshom med pa'i blo'o //
translated: The mind is free from doubt because it is the source of the knowledge of all the philosophies, mundane and transcendental, and because it teaches the truth to all beings without error.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po ma lus pa'i ngo bo'i phyir kun don no ;
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po ma lus pa'i ngo bo'i phyir kun don no ;
translated: It is the universal ground because it is the nature of all things, both animate and inanimate.

original: / sgrib pa med pa'i rdul mun pa snying stobs kyi yon tan gcig gi rang bzhin gyi phyir yon tan gsum byi bdag go //
analyzed: / sgrib pa med pa'i rdul mun pa snying stobs kyi yon tan gcig gi rang bzhin gyi phyir yon tan gsum byi bdag go //
translated: It is the lord of the three qualities because it is the nature of the single quality of sattva, which is free from the obscuring qualities of rajas and tamas.

original: sbyor ba yan lag drug gis rang byin gyis brlabs pa gsal bar gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba yan lag drug gis rang byin gyis brlabs pa gsal bar gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the self because it is the light of the sixfold yoga, which is the self-consecration.

original: phung po lnga'i don rnams ni sangs rgyas ni phung po lnga don no //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i don rnams ni sangs rgyas ni phung po lnga don no //
translated: The meaning of the five aggregates is the Buddha, because the five aggregates are the meaning of the Buddha.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis dus gsum du'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis dus gsum du'o //
translated: It is the three times because it is eternal.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gi skad cig thams cad bde ba chen por bye brag phyed pas sgyur par byed pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gi skad cig thams cad bde ba chen por bye brag phyed pas sgyur par byed pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: It is the transformer because it distinguishes all the moments of the wind of conceptualization as great bliss.

original: bzhi pa'i skad cig kho nas dngos kun dang tha mi dad pa /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i skad cig kho nas dngos kun dang tha mi dad pa /
translated: In the very instant of the fourth, he is not different from all things,

original: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa po'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa po'o //
translated: and is called Samantabhadra, the perfect Buddha, the knower.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang ste lhan skyes 'dzin pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang ste lhan skyes 'dzin pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: he is the holder of the nature of all Buddhas, meaning the innate holder.

original: gtsug tor gyi nor bu'i 'khor lor son pa nyid kyis lus med ni chos kyi dbyings rdo rje'i lus med do //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi nor bu'i 'khor lor son pa nyid kyis lus med ni chos kyi dbyings rdo rje'i lus med do //
translated: Since he is located in the wheel of the jewel of the crown, he is bodiless, meaning he is without the body of the vajra element of reality.

original: de nyid bde ba bsags pa'i ngo bo'i phyir lus kyi mchog gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid bde ba bsags pa'i ngo bo'i phyir lus kyi mchog gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: Since he is the essence of the accumulation of bliss, he is the supreme body, as the text says.

original: bde ba chen po nyid kyis lus kyi mtha' ston par byed /
analyzed: bde ba chen po nyid kyis lus kyi mtha' ston par byed /
translated: Since he is great bliss, he is the revealer of the end of the body.

original: spro bar byad pas na lus kyi mtha' ni ston pa po'o //
analyzed: spro bar byad pas na lus kyi mtha' ni ston pa po'o //
translated: Since he is the emanator, he is the revealer of the end of the body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gdul bya'i bsam pas gzugs rnams sna tshogs kun du ston no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gdul bya'i bsam pas gzugs rnams sna tshogs kun du ston no //
translated: For that very reason, he displays various forms in accordance with the thoughts of those to be tamed.

original: nor bu chen por gnas pa'i phyir nor bu chen po'o //
analyzed: nor bu chen por gnas pa'i phyir nor bu chen po'o //
translated: Since he is located in the great jewel, he is the great jewel.

original: skye bo chen po thams cad sgyur pa'i don du @86a * //
analyzed: skye bo chen po thams cad sgyur pa'i don du @86a * //
translated: For the sake of transforming all great beings,

original: bde ba rin po ches mtshan pa'i tog ni rin chen tog go //
analyzed: bde ba rin po ches mtshan pa'i tog ni rin chen tog go //
translated: Ratnaketu, who is marked with the jewel of bliss, is Ratnake tu.

original: 'di ni yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa dang / sa bcu gnyis rab tu thob pa'i rnam par dag pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o /
analyzed: 'di ni yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa dang / sa bcu gnyis rab tu thob pa'i rnam par dag pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o /
translated: These twenty-four verses are on the intuition of sameness, in its purification of the twelve stages and the cessation of the twelve members.

original: // / da ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga'i sgo nas sgrib pa med pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po don yod grub pa'i tshul gyis mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes de nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: // / da ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga'i sgo nas sgrib pa med pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po don yod grub pa'i tshul gyis mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes de nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, fifteen verses on the intuition of duty-fulfillment, as the mode of Amoghasiddhi, that is, the intuition of supreme non-regression.

original: dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi rtogs par bya ba mngon sum du bya ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te ;
analyzed: dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi rtogs par bya ba mngon sum du bya ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te ;
translated: The intuition of the three times is the intuition of the nature of the realization of all the Buddhas.

original: de nyid 'jam dpal ye shes kyi sku'o zhes pa'i mthar ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'jam dpal ye shes kyi sku'o zhes pa'i mthar ro //
translated: That is the very Manjusri, the embodiment of intuition.

original: de skad du /üîΩkhyod la rag las mngon byang chub //
analyzed: de skad du / khyod la rag las mngon byang chub //
translated: As it is said:üîΩYou are the father of the all-seeing one,

original: khyod ni thams cad gzigs pa'i yab //
analyzed: khyod ni thams cad gzigs pa'i yab //
translated: You are the mother of the Sugata.

original: khyod ni 'byung zhing 'byung 'gyur pa //
analyzed: khyod ni 'byung zhing 'byung 'gyur pa //
translated: You are the source and will be the source

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan //
translated: of the Tathagatas.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'i dpal kho na sangs rgyas byang chub po //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'i dpal kho na sangs rgyas byang chub po //
translated: The Buddha is enlightened by the very nature of the body, speech, and mind, and is therefore the nondual glory itself.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzhi pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir bla na med do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzhi pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir bla na med do //
translated: It is unsurpassed because it is the very nature of the fourth enlightenment.

original: lhan skyes kyi bsgrigs pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i gsang sngags kyi skye gnas rgyu nyid bcom ldan kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan skyes kyi bsgrigs pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i gsang sngags kyi skye gnas rgyu nyid bcom ldan kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One is the very source of the worldly and other mantras, due to the innate arrangement.

original: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi 'brel pa med bzhin pa nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bdag nyid ni yi ger med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi 'brel pa med bzhin pa nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bdag nyid ni yi ger med pa'o //
translated: The dharmadhatu, which is the supreme unchanging nature, is without syllables, due to the absence of the connection between the expressed and the expresser.

original: gzugs dang yon tan la sogs pa'i brjod pa las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs dang yon tan la sogs pa'i brjod pa las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is beyond the expression of form, qualities, and so on. This is the meaning.

original: 'byin byed dang / 'gengs byed dang / bum pa can mi 'gyur pa nyid kyis rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir gsang sngags chen po'i bdag nyid rigs gsum pa lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang khyad par gyi dga' ba'i ngo bo gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byin byed dang / 'gengs byed dang / bum pa can mi 'gyur pa nyid kyis rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir gsang sngags chen po'i bdag nyid rigs gsum pa lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang khyad par gyi dga' ba'i ngo bo gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The great mantra is the nature of the three families, which are to be known by oneself through the retention of the bindu, the filling, and the vase empowerment, which are unchanging.

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten pa'i sngags dang / mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i sbyor bas thig le dang n'a da'i bdag nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags de nyid bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir don to //
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten pa'i sngags dang / mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i sbyor bas thig le dang n'a da'i bdag nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags de nyid bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mantra is to be accomplished, which is the mundane mantra characterized by the recitation of pacifying, increasing, and so on, and the supramundane mantra, which is the nature of the bindu and nƒÅda through the practice of the unchanging.

original: gsang sngags don kun phyag rgya chen po'i don ni /üîΩde skyed pa @86b po skyed byed do //
analyzed: gsang sngags don kun phyag rgya chen po'i don ni /üîΩde skyed pa @86b po skyed byed do //
translated: The meaning of all mantras is the meaning of mahƒÅmudrƒÅ.üîΩThe meaning of the great seal is the meaning of the great mudra.

original: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya shaksha aom gyi yi ge sde tshan bcu srog la sogs pa rlung bcu po rnams dbu mar rgyu ba nyid kyi gcig tu gyur pa lus thams cad la thim pa'i phyir thig le chen po bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya shaksha aom gyi yi ge sde tshan bcu srog la sogs pa rlung bcu po rnams dbu mar rgyu ba nyid kyi gcig tu gyur pa lus thams cad la thim pa'i phyir thig le chen po bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The ten groups of letters, a ka ca ·π≠a ta pa ya ≈õa, o·πÉ, are the ten winds such as the life-force wind, which become one by moving in the central channel and dissolve into the whole body, and thus are the Great Drop, the BhagavƒÅn.

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir yi ge med pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir yi ge med pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Because of being the ultimate nature, the letterless, the pristine wisdom of supreme unchanging bliss, is Vajrasattva.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: In the Root Tantra:

original: lus ngag sems kyi khams rnams kyi //
analyzed: lus ngag sems kyi khams rnams kyi //
translated: Because the elements of body, speech, and mind

original: gang phyir skyabs gyur de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skyabs gyur de yi phyir //
translated: are the refuge,

original: sngags don sngags kyi sgra yis ni //
analyzed: sngags don sngags kyi sgra yis ni //
translated: the meaning of mantra, the sound of mantra,

original: stod nyid yi shes mi 'gyur pa //
analyzed: stod nyid yi shes mi 'gyur pa //
translated: is the unchanging pristine wisdom.

original: bsod nams ye shes las byung sngags //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes las byung sngags //
translated: The mantra that arises from merit and pristine wisdom

original: stong nyid snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
translated: is the nature of emptiness and compassion.

original: zhes so // dbus su ye shes kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / ye shes kyi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / yid dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams dang / mchog gi dbang po dang /
analyzed: zhes so // dbus su ye shes kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / ye shes kyi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / yid dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams dang / mchog gi dbang po dang /
translated: In the center, the aggregate of gnosis, the aggregate of consciousness, the element of gnosis, the element of space, the mind, the ear, sound, the element of phenomena, the supreme organ,

original: bha ga dang / chu 'dzag pa dang / khu ba 'dzag pa'i ngo bo rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid so sor rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa nyid ro mnyam par 'gyur pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa stong pa'i yi ge dang po rnal 'byor pa rang gi rig par bya ba
analyzed: bha ga dang / chu 'dzag pa dang / khu ba 'dzag pa'i ngo bo rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid so sor rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa nyid ro mnyam par 'gyur pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa stong pa'i yi ge dang po rnal 'byor pa rang gi rig par bya ba
translated: the bhaga, the essence of the emission of water, and the emission of semen are non-obstructed, each one abandoning the apprehension of its own object, and they become of one taste, mixed into one, the first syllable of emptiness, which is to be known by the yogi himself.

original: thams cad med pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid gzhom du med pa aa'i yi ge stong par mi tsam brjod du med pa gri gug gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad med pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid gzhom du med pa aa'i yi ge stong par mi tsam brjod du med pa gri gug gi rnam pa'o //
translated: That reality, which is not characterized by nonexistence, is the syllable of A, which is indestructible, empty, inexpressible, and the form of a flaying knife.

original: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma las /
translated: From the indestructible center, the sign of the indestructible,

original: shar du 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rlung gi khams dang / sna dang / reg bya dang / ngag gi dbang po dang / bshang ba 'dzag pa rnams gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa stong pa'i yi ge ae dbyug pa'i rnam pa stong pa'i yi ge gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: shar du 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rlung gi khams dang / sna dang / reg bya dang / ngag gi dbang po dang / bshang ba 'dzag pa rnams gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa stong pa'i yi ge ae dbyug pa'i rnam pa stong pa'i yi ge gnyis pa'o //
translated: In the east, the aggregate of formation, the wind element, the nose, the tangible, the faculty of speech, and the emission of feces, all mixed into one, are the empty syllable e, the second empty syllable in the form of a club.

original: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i g-yas su tshor ba'i phung po dang / me'i khams dang / mig dang / ro dang / lag pa dang / 'gro ba rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid stong pa'i yi ge ri thig le gnyis te stong pa'i yi ge gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i g-yas su tshor ba'i phung po dang / me'i khams dang / mig dang / ro dang / lag pa dang / 'gro ba rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid stong pa'i yi ge ri thig le gnyis te stong pa'i yi ge gsum pa'o //
translated: To the right of the indestructible center, the aggregate of feeling, the fire element, the eyes, taste, the hands, and movement, all mixed into one, are the empty syllable ri, the third empty syllable, which is a bindu with two dots.

original: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i g-yon du 'du shes kyi phung po dang / chu'i khams dang / lce dang / gzugs dang / rkang pa dang / len pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid stong pa'i yi ge au brjod du med pa thig le gcig gi gzugs stong pa chen po'i yi ge @87a * //
analyzed: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i g-yon du 'du shes kyi phung po dang / chu'i khams dang / lce dang / gzugs dang / rkang pa dang / len pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid stong pa'i yi ge au brjod du med pa thig le gcig gi gzugs stong pa chen po'i yi ge @87a * //
translated: To the left of the sign of the indestructible center, the aggregate of perception, the water element, the tongue, form, the legs, and grasping are the inexpressible syllable u of the emptiness of the reality of the indivisibility of the inexpressible, the form of the single bindu, the syllable of great emptiness.üîΩTo the west of the sign of the indestructible center, the aggregate of form, the earth element, the body sense faculty, smell, the anus, and speech are the syllable li of the emptiness of the five sense objects, the syllable of the emptiness of the five sense faculties, the syllable of the emptiness of the five afflictions, the syllable of the emptiness of the five gnoses, and the syllable of the emptiness of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: bzhi pa'o // dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i nub tu gzugs kyi phung po dang / sa'i khams dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / dri dang / bshang khung dang / smra ba rnams ro mnyam pa nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ha la'i rnam pa stong pa'i yi ge li stong pa'i yi ge lnga pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa'o // dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i nub tu gzugs kyi phung po dang / sa'i khams dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / dri dang / bshang khung dang / smra ba rnams ro mnyam pa nyid gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid ha la'i rnam pa stong pa'i yi ge li stong pa'i yi ge lnga pa ste /
translated: To the north of the sign of the indestructible center, the aggregate of formations, the fire element, the speech sense faculty, taste, the sexual organ, and mental activity are the syllable e of the emptiness of the five sense objects, the syllable of the emptiness of the five sense faculties, the syllable of the emptiness of the five afflictions, the syllable of the emptiness of the five gnoses, and the syllable of the emptiness of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: 'di ltar bam gyi rnam pa yi ge lnga stong pa chen po dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid can rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa pra phab pa dang mnyam pa rnal 'byor pa'i rtogs bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bam gyi rnam pa yi ge lnga stong pa chen po dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i bdag nyid can rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa pra phab pa dang mnyam pa rnal 'byor pa'i rtogs bya'o //
translated: Thus, the five seed syllables in the form of Bam, which are the nature of great emptiness, non-referential compassion, beyond the dharmatƒÅ of subtle particles, equal to a mirror divination, are the realization of the yogi.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa ae'i rnam pa chos 'byung gi tshul rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni thig le stong pa yi ge drug go //
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa ae'i rnam pa chos 'byung gi tshul rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni thig le stong pa yi ge drug go //
translated: The form of the vowel A, which is the support of that, is the nature of emptiness of all aspects, the way of the source of phenomena, the empty bindu of six syllables.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rna ba dang / chos kyi khams dang / bha ga dang / khu ba 'dzag pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba stong pa nyid sngar bshad pa'i dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i steng du ka'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge ka brjod du med pa ni thig le stong pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rna ba dang / chos kyi khams dang / bha ga dang / khu ba 'dzag pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba stong pa nyid sngar bshad pa'i dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i steng du ka'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge ka brjod du med pa ni thig le stong pa dang po'o //
translated: Similarly, the aggregate of consciousness, the element of space, the ear, the element of phenomena, the bhaga, and the emission of semen, free from obscurations, are the empty bindu of the first syllable Ka, the nature of the class of Ka, the inexpressible, on top of the indestructible, unextinguishable bindu explained above.

original: shar gyi mtshan ma'i shar du 'du shes kyi phung po dang / rlung gi khams dang / sna'i dbang po dang / reg bya dang / ngag dang / bshad ba 'dzag pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba thams cad stong pa nyid tsa'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge tsa brjid du med pa'i thig le stong pa nyid pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi mtshan ma'i shar du 'du shes kyi phung po dang / rlung gi khams dang / sna'i dbang po dang / reg bya dang / ngag dang / bshad ba 'dzag pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba thams cad stong pa nyid tsa'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge tsa brjid du med pa'i thig le stong pa nyid pa'o //
translated: In the east of the eastern sign is the aggregate of perception, the wind element, the nose faculty, tactile objects, speech, and the emission of semen. All of these are free from obscurations, the nature of the ca group, the clear-light syllable ca, the empty bindu without pride.

original: g-yas kyi mtshan ma'i g-yas su tshor ba'i phung po dang / me'i khams dang / mig dang / ro dang / lag pa'i dbang po dang / 'gro ba rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid /
analyzed: g-yas kyi mtshan ma'i g-yas su tshor ba'i phung po dang / me'i khams dang / mig dang / ro dang / lag pa'i dbang po dang / 'gro ba rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid /
translated: In the right of the right sign is the aggregate of feeling, the fire element, the eyes, tastes, the hand faculty, and going. All of these are free from obscurations, the emptiness of all aspects.

original: ta'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge ta brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: ta'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge ta brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The nature of the ta group, the clear-light syllable ta, the empty bindu without expression, is the third.

original: g-yon gyi mtshan ma'i g-yon du 'du shes kyi phung po dang / chu'i khams dang / lce dang / gzugs dang / rkang pa'i dbang po dang / len pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid pa'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge pa brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi mtshan ma'i g-yon du 'du shes kyi phung po dang / chu'i khams dang / lce dang / gzugs dang / rkang pa'i dbang po dang / len pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid pa'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge pa brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: On the left of the left sign, the aggregate of perception, the water element, the tongue, form, the foot sense-faculty, and grasping are the emptiness of the class of the letter pa, which is the nature of the clear light free from obscuration, the fourth empty bindu of inexpressible vital essence.

original: nub kyi mtshan ma'i nub tu gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i phung po dang / sa'i khams dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / dri dang / 'jug pa'i dbang po dang / brjod pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid ta'i sde @87b tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge ta brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nub kyi mtshan ma'i nub tu gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i phung po dang / sa'i khams dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / dri dang / 'jug pa'i dbang po dang / brjod pa rnams sgrib pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid ta'i sde @87b tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge ta brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa lnga pa'o //
translated: On the west of the west sign, the aggregate of form, the earth element, the body sense-faculty, smell, the engaging sense-faculty, and expression are the emptiness of the class of the letter ta, which is the nature of the clear light free from obscuration, the fifth empty bindu of inexpressible vital essence.

original: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i 'og ngos su ye shes kyi phung po dang / ye shes kyi khams dang / yid dang / sgra dang / mchog gi dbang po dang / chu 'dzag pa rnams rnam pa thams cad sgrib pa dang bral ba stong pa nyid sa'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma gzhom du med pa'i mtshan ma'i 'og ngos su ye shes kyi phung po dang / ye shes kyi khams dang / yid dang / sgra dang / mchog gi dbang po dang / chu 'dzag pa rnams rnam pa thams cad sgrib pa dang bral ba stong pa nyid sa'i sde tshan gyi bdag nyid gsal byed kyi yi ge brjod du med pa'i thig le stong pa drug pa'o //
translated: On the lower side of the sign of the invincible center of the middle channel, the aggregate of pristine consciousness, the element of pristine consciousness, the mind, sound, the supreme organ, and the dripping of water are all aspects free from obscuration, the nature of the class of emptiness, the syllable of the manifest, the empty bindu that is inexpressible.

original: de ltar thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni chos kyi 'byung gnas rdo rje 'dzin pa ae'i rnam pa stong pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa pra phab pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de ltar thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni chos kyi 'byung gnas rdo rje 'dzin pa ae'i rnam pa stong pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa pra phab pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Thus, the six syllables of the empty bindu are the source of phenomena, the aspect of the e of Vajradhara, emptiness with an object, and the nature of a mirror divination.

original: de dag gi stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni dbyangs kyi tshogs khu ba dang zla ba zhes brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi stong pa chen po yi ge lnga ni dbyangs kyi tshogs khu ba dang zla ba zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: The five syllables of the great emptiness of those are the collection of vowels, which should be called ‚Äúsemen and moon.‚Äù

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni gsal byed kyi tshogs rdul dang nyi ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug ni gsal byed kyi tshogs rdul dang nyi ma zhes brjod do //
translated: The six syllables of the empty bindu are the collection of consonants, which should be called ‚Äúovum and sun.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang khu ba dang zla ba ni bam gyi rnam pa rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang khu ba dang zla ba ni bam gyi rnam pa rdo rje'o //
translated: Here also, semen and the moon are the form of Bam, which is the vajra.

original: rdul dang nyi ma ni ae'i rnam pa padma'o //
analyzed: rdul dang nyi ma ni ae'i rnam pa padma'o //
translated: Menses and the sun are the form of E, which is the lotus.

original: rdo rje dang padma 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: These vajra and lotus are one, which is called Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje ni mchog tu bde ba'i ye shes khu ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mchog tu bde ba'i ye shes khu ba'o //
translated: Vajra is the semen, which is the gnosis of supreme bliss.

original: sems dpa' ni thams cad kyi rnam pa shes rab kyi gzugs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' ni thams cad kyi rnam pa shes rab kyi gzugs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Sattva is the form of wisdom, which is called the form of all.

original: ye shes dang rnam par shes pa byin gyis brlabs pa sgrib pa dang bral ba gcig tu gyur pa de kho na nyid 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang rnam par shes pa byin gyis brlabs pa sgrib pa dang bral ba gcig tu gyur pa de kho na nyid 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: That very Vajrasattva is the blessing of gnosis and consciousness, which is the single state free from obscurations, the one who performs the welfare of the world.

original: de dag kyang rgya cher 'grel pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las gsungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgya cher 'grel pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las gsungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Those should be understood as taught in the extensive commentary, Vimalaprabha.üîΩThe cause is stated:

original: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med ni rgyu gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med ni rgyu gsungs pa ste /
translated: Endowed with all aspects, devoid of aspects,

original: so sor sdud pas bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang mthong ba phra phab pa dang mtshungs par rab tu snang ba ni rnam pa kun ldan te rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor sdud pas bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang mthong ba phra phab pa dang mtshungs par rab tu snang ba ni rnam pa kun ldan te rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The appearance of whatever thing is seen, such as a vase, and so on, by means of withdrawal is endowed with all aspects, because it is seen by nonconceptual, nonerroneous direct perception.

original: rnam pa med pa rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa ste rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir bkab pa dang ma bkab pa'i mig gi rtogs bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa ste rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir bkab pa dang ma bkab pa'i mig gi rtogs bya'o //
translated: The absence of aspects is beyond the dharmatƒÅ of subtle particles, because it is free from conceptuality. It is to be realized by the eyes, whether covered or uncovered.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med pa rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med pa rgyu ste /
translated: Thus, the cause is endowed with all aspects, without aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The supreme perfection of wisdom is emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba ni bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba ni bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang ste /
translated: The result born from that is the supreme unchanging bliss, which is the bearer of the bindu of the half-half.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi shes rab ye shes chen po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi shes rab ye shes chen po zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the great gnosis of wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: @88a * // de skad du yang /
analyzed: @88a * // de skad du yang /
translated: As such,

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
translated: The emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations

original: stong pa nyid rgyu ni dang po nas //üîΩdmigs pa med par byas nas phyis //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rgyu ni dang po nas // dmigs pa med par byas nas phyis //
translated: is the cause, and the first

original: 'gro don mdzad pa 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'gro don mdzad pa 'bras bu'o //
translated: is the result, which is the activity for the sake of beings,üîΩonce one has made it free of reference points.

original: zhes so // cha bcu drug po rnams kyi phyed brgyad de /
analyzed: zhes so // cha bcu drug po rnams kyi phyed brgyad de /
translated: The sixteen aspects are divided into eight halves.

original: de'i phyir thig le bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thig le bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, there are four bindus.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems dang / ye shes kyi mtshan nyid sad pa dang / rmi lam dang / gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i gnas skabs skyed pa po de 'dzin pas na bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang ngo //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems dang / ye shes kyi mtshan nyid sad pa dang / rmi lam dang / gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i gnas skabs skyed pa po de 'dzin pas na bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang ngo //
translated: The one who holds the sixteen halves, the one who generates the four states of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and the fourth, which have the characteristics of body, speech, mind, and gnosis, is the one who holds the sixteen halves.

original: dam tshig bzhi skyong ba po rdo rje sems dpa' chags pa chen po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dam tshig bzhi skyong ba po rdo rje sems dpa' chags pa chen po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The one who protects the four commitments is the great passion of Vajrasattva.

original: yan lag med pa dkar po'i phyogs kyi cha bco lnga dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: yan lag med pa dkar po'i phyogs kyi cha bco lnga dang bral ba ste /
translated: The one without limbs is free from the fifteen aspects of the bright fortnight.

original: de rnams kyi mthar gnas pa dkar po'i nya'i mthar ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mthar gnas pa dkar po'i nya'i mthar ro //
translated: The one who abides at the end of those is at the end of the bright fortnight.

original: rtsis las 'das pa ni rtsis nag po'i tshes gcig go //
analyzed: rtsis las 'das pa ni rtsis nag po'i tshes gcig go //
translated: The one beyond calculation is the first day of the dark fortnight.

original: der mi 'jug pa ni rtsis las 'das pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: der mi 'jug pa ni rtsis las 'das pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of co-emergent is beyond calculation, not entering there.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo can //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo can //
translated: The peak of the fourth concentration.

original: zhes pa ni dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni dang po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni dang po'o //
translated: The first concentration is the concentration of the bliss of joy.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second concentration is the concentration of the bliss of supreme joy.

original: khyad par gyi dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third concentration is the concentration of the bliss of special joy.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'i bsam gtan ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth concentration is the concentration of the bliss of co-emergent joy.

original: tshes lnga dang / tshes bcu dang / nya dang / nya'i mthar thig le la mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i bsam gtan gnas pa de'i rtse mo mchog gi cha bde ba yongs su gang ba nyid de /
analyzed: tshes lnga dang / tshes bcu dang / nya dang / nya'i mthar thig le la mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i bsam gtan gnas pa de'i rtse mo mchog gi cha bde ba yongs su gang ba nyid de /
translated: The peak of that concentration of the bliss of supreme changelessness abiding in the bindu on the fifth, tenth, thirtieth, and thirtieth day is the complete filling of the bliss of the supreme part.

original: de 'chang bas na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de 'chang bas na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang ngo //
translated: Since one holds that, one holds the peak of the fourth concentration.

original: shes bya ye shes 'char rtog pa //
analyzed: shes bya ye shes 'char rtog pa //
translated: The wisdom of the object of knowledge arises as the thought.

original: dpyod pa de yi sbyor ba nyid //
analyzed: dpyod pa de yi sbyor ba nyid //
translated: The analysis is the yoga of that.

original: gsum pa dga' ba lta bu ste //
analyzed: gsum pa dga' ba lta bu ste //
translated: The third is like joy.

original: bzhi pa bde ba bsdus pa ste //
analyzed: bzhi pa bde ba bsdus pa ste //
translated: The fourth is the collection of bliss.

original: lnga pa rtag tu snang ba ni //
analyzed: lnga pa rtag tu snang ba ni //
translated: 5. He is always visible,

original: sprin med nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: sprin med nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: like the cloudless sky.

original: zhes pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag lnga kun nas shes pa'i phyir bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag lnga kun nas shes pa'i phyir bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing ngo //
translated: He knows the concentrations, because he knows the five branches of concentration.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs dang stobs rig pa'i phyir ting 'dzin rig dang rgyud rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs dang stobs rig pa'i phyir ting 'dzin rig dang rgyud rig pa'o //
translated: He knows the concentrations and their continuity, because he knows the force of the collection of concentrations such as the concentration of the equality of all things.

original: ting 'dzin lus can chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: ting 'dzin lus can chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The concentration body is the Dharma Body.

original: 'di kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku dag gi mchog gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku dag gi mchog gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: It is the best of the beatific and transformation bodies, as the case may be.

original: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'khor kun gyi dbus su mdzes pas na longs spyod rdzogs sku @88b kun gyi rgyal lo //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'khor kun gyi dbus su mdzes pas na longs spyod rdzogs sku @88b kun gyi rgyal lo //
translated: The beatific body is the king of all beatific bodies, because it is beautiful in the middle of the retinue, being the Dharma Body which is not different from the beatific body.

original: lhun gyis grub pa dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba'i don sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sprul pa'i sku kho na sprul pa gzhan rnams kyi nang na mchog gi sprul pa'i sku ste sku'i mchog go //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba'i don sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sprul pa'i sku kho na sprul pa gzhan rnams kyi nang na mchog gi sprul pa'i sku ste sku'i mchog go //
translated: The supreme body is the supreme emanation body alone, which has the nature of various kinds of emanations for the sake of beings, which are spontaneously present.

original: rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i rigs gsum dang / rigs lnga la sogs pa'i rgyud 'od gsal nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i rigs gsum dang / rigs lnga la sogs pa'i rgyud 'od gsal nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir de bzhin no //
translated: It is just so because the tantras of the three families, the five families, and so on, together with their natures, are held to be luminosity.

original: phyogs bcur sbrul pa sna tshogs 'gyed cing spro ba gang gis yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcur sbrul pa sna tshogs 'gyed cing spro ba gang gis yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just so because it is that which emanates and radiates various emanations into the ten directions.

original: rang ji lta bar 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang ji lta bar 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
translated: It is just so because it acts for the sake of beings in just the same way as they are.

original: 'od gsal ga'i sems rdo rje nyid kyis khyab 'jug gi rang bzhin gyi phyir lha'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ga'i sems rdo rje nyid kyis khyab 'jug gi rang bzhin gyi phyir lha'i dbang po'o //
translated: It is the lord of gods because it is the nature of Vi·π£·πáu by means of the mind vajra of luminosity.

original: chags pa chen po'i bdag nyid kyi lus nyid kyis tshangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir lha'i lha'o //
analyzed: chags pa chen po'i bdag nyid kyi lus nyid kyis tshangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir lha'i lha'o //
translated: It is the god of gods because it is the nature of BrahmƒÅ by means of the body that has the nature of great passion.

original: nor bu'i nang dang gtsug tor du bgrod pas stobs ldan gyi ngo bo'i phyir lha min dbang po'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i nang dang gtsug tor du bgrod pas stobs ldan gyi ngo bo'i phyir lha min dbang po'o //
translated: He is the lord of the demigods because he is the essence of the powerful one, since he moves in the interior of the gem and the cranial dome.

original: dpe med pa'i gnyis su med pa'i dpal gyi bdud rtsi thob pas sgra gcan gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir lha min bdag go ;
analyzed: dpe med pa'i gnyis su med pa'i dpal gyi bdud rtsi thob pas sgra gcan gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir lha min bdag go ;
translated: He is the lord of the demigods because he is the essence of Rahu, since he obtains the nectar of incomparable nondual glory.

original: / bdag med pas srung gi bu la gnas pa nyid kyis brgya byin gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir 'chi med dbang po'o //
analyzed: / bdag med pas srung gi bu la gnas pa nyid kyis brgya byin gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir 'chi med dbang po'o //
translated: He is the lord of immortality because he is the essence of Indra, since he abides in the son of Vinata, the garuda, by means of his selflessness.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par ston pa nyid kyis phur bu'i rang bzhin gyi phyir lha'i bla'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par ston pa nyid kyis phur bu'i rang bzhin gyi phyir lha'i bla'o //
translated: He is the lord of the gods because he is the essence of Brihaspati, since he teaches all phenomena to be essenceless.

original: bde ba chen po'i khu ba mche bas phyogs gcig pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs dbang du byas pa nyid kyis bgegs kyi bdag po'i phyir 'joms byed do //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i khu ba mche bas phyogs gcig pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs dbang du byas pa nyid kyis bgegs kyi bdag po'i phyir 'joms byed do //
translated: He is the destroyer because he subjugates the hosts of obstacles such as the aggregates, etc., with his fangs of great bliss.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid grol ba'i ngo bo spyan gsum pa'i ngo bo'i phyir 'joms byed dbang phyug pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid grol ba'i ngo bo spyan gsum pa'i ngo bo'i phyir 'joms byed dbang phyug pa'o //
translated: He is the lord of the destroyer because he is the essence of the three eyes, since he is the essence of the liberation of body, speech, and mind.

original: sems can thams cad la yang dag pa'i ye shes rab tu ston pa po nyid kyis srid pa'i dgon pa las rgal ba'o ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang dag pa'i ye shes rab tu ston pa po nyid kyis srid pa'i dgon pa las rgal ba'o ;
translated: He is the one who has crossed over the wilderness of existence by virtue of his teaching of perfect pristine awareness to all sentient beings.

original: / sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams la bde ba chen po 'byung ba'i ston pa'i phyir ston pa gcig pu gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: / sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams la bde ba chen po 'byung ba'i ston pa'i phyir ston pa gcig pu gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: He is the sole teacher, the nondual one, because he is the teacher who brings about the great bliss of those who are afflicted by various sufferings.

original: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas rnam par mi g-yo ba'i bde ba'i ye shes la gnas pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas rnam par mi g-yo ba'i bde ba'i ye shes la gnas pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i bla ma'o //
translated: He is the guru of the world because he abides in the pristine awareness of immovable bliss by virtue of the complete pacification of all conceptual elaborations.

original: 'jig rten byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The world is the bodhisattvas and so on.

original: phyogs bcur rab grags pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la sogs pas rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur rab grags pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la sogs pas rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: He is renowned in the ten directions because he is renowned by virtue of his accumulation of merit and so on.

original: de rnams la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la sogs par rab tu snang ba nyid kyis chos kyi sbyin bdag go //
analyzed: de rnams la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la sogs par rab tu snang ba nyid kyis chos kyi sbyin bdag go //
translated: He is the lord of Dharma because he appears as the enjoyment body and so on to those.

original: che ba po ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i bdag nyid khyab @89a * //
analyzed: che ba po ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i bdag nyid khyab @89a * //
translated: The great one is the pervasive lord of the animate and inanimate.

original: pa'o ; / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'i sems can ni byams pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o ; / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'i sems can ni byams pa ste /
translated: The sentient being who is the bliss of the innate joy is love.

original: de nyid lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir go cha'o //
analyzed: de nyid lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir go cha'o //
translated: That itself is the armor because it pervades the entire body.

original: des chas pa bkab pa'o //üîΩsems kyi rnam par g-yeng ba gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des chas pa bkab pa'o // sems kyi rnam par g-yeng ba gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the covering because it covers the body.üîΩThe mind is the bow because it is the basis of the arrow.üîΩThe arrow is the mind because it is the basis of the bow.üîΩThe arrow is the mind because it is the basis of the bow.

original: sngar brjod pa'i snying rje'i ya lad kyis bgos pa bsrung pa'o //üîΩdri ma dang bral bar gyur pa phyag rgya chen po ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i snying rje'i ya lad kyis bgos pa bsrung pa'o // dri ma dang bral bar gyur pa phyag rgya chen po ni shes rab ste /
translated: The mind is the bow because it is the basis of the arrow.üîΩThe mind is the bow because it is the basis of the arrow.

original: de ral gri gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //üîΩmda' thig le dang / gzhu n'a da de gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir de bzhin no //
analyzed: de ral gri gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no // mda' thig le dang / gzhu n'a da de gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir de bzhin no //
translated: The arrow is the mind because it is the basis of the bow.üîΩThe mind is the bow because it is the basis of the arrow.üîΩThe arrow is the mind because it is the basis of the bow.üîΩThe mind is the bow because it is the basis of the arrow.üîΩThe arrow is the mind because it is the basis of the bow.
