original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas las //
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas las //
translated: From the glorious Original Buddha,

original: 'gyur zhing 'gyur pa de nas 'dzag / mi 'dzag dri ma med pa gzhan //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing 'gyur pa de nas 'dzag / mi 'dzag dri ma med pa gzhan //
translated: it flows and flows again, and then drips, and then is not dripping, and then is stainless.

original: padmar rdo rje bcug pas rtse mo can dang rlung las thigs pa lhung ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: padmar rdo rje bcug pas rtse mo can dang rlung las thigs pa lhung ba gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the drop falling from the lotus, the vajra inserted into the lotus, and the wind.

original: rnal 'byor gsum po 'di dag nges pa kho nar sku gsung thugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gsum po 'di dag nges pa kho nar sku gsung thugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: These three yogas are definitely the mudras of body, speech, and mind.

original: chags dang chags bral thog mthar son pa mchog gi bde ster rnal 'byor bgrod bya bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral thog mthar son pa mchog gi bde ster rnal 'byor bgrod bya bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the yoga that is the supreme bliss, which is the end of both desire and non-desire.

original: phyag rgya rnams kyi ma de rnam pa bcu por 'gyur te 'di ni dpal ldan bla ma'i zhal //
analyzed: phyag rgya rnams kyi ma de rnam pa bcu por 'gyur te 'di ni dpal ldan bla ma'i zhal //
translated: The mother of all mudras is these ten aspects. This is the face of the glorious guru.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: Also, in the glorious Vairocana Abhisambodhi Tantra, it says:

original: las kyi phyag rgya mnyam bsten nas //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya mnyam bsten nas //
translated: Having relied on the action mudra,

original: chos kyi phyag rgya rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya rnam par bsgom //
translated: meditate on the dharma mudra.

original: de nas gong du phyag rgya che //
analyzed: de nas gong du phyag rgya che //
translated: Then, above that, the great mudra

original: de yi dam tshig 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dam tshig 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: will arise as its commitment.

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan du yang /
analyzed: gzhan du yang /
translated: Also, elsewhere:

original: thar pa dpal mo mi 'jigs bde ba dge / lang tsho dga' ma bcom ldan ma de dor //
analyzed: thar pa dpal mo mi 'jigs bde ba dge / lang tsho dga' ma bcom ldan ma de dor //
translated: youth, and joy are cast aside by that Blessed One.

original: phal cher sngon du bsags pa'i drag shul las //
analyzed: phal cher sngon du bsags pa'i drag shul las //
translated: For the most part, he is the result of the violence of former actions.

original: gang gi bdud rtsi dor nas dug 'thung byed //
analyzed: gang gi bdud rtsi dor nas dug 'thung byed //
translated: He casts away nectar and drinks poison.

original: ces gsungs so //üîΩdang po'i @92a * //
analyzed: ces gsungs so // dang po'i @92a * //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sangs rgyas las kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las kyang //
translated: In the Tantra of the Great Natural Arising of Awareness,üîΩit says:üîΩThe four seals are the unchanging bliss that is bestowed as the result.

original: phyag rgya bzhi po mi 'gyur bde ba'i 'bras bu ster ba 'di rnams rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi po mi 'gyur bde ba'i 'bras bu ster ba 'di rnams rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom //
translated: The yogi/ni meditates on this.

original: kun du dus kun du ni dga' ba'i chags pa la gnas 'jig rten lam las rab grol bas //
analyzed: kun du dus kun du ni dga' ba'i chags pa la gnas 'jig rten lam las rab grol bas //
translated: Always and forever, abiding in the passion of joy, free from the worldly path,

original: grong dang dgon pa dur khrod ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas dang khyim dang lha yi gnas dag tu //
analyzed: grong dang dgon pa dur khrod ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas dang khyim dang lha yi gnas dag tu //
translated: in the village, the monastery, the charnel ground, the pure and impure places, the house, and the celestial palace,

original: rigs dang rigs min dang bral lus kyi stobs dang bde ster bza' btung la sogs dang ldan pas //
analyzed: rigs dang rigs min dang bral lus kyi stobs dang bde ster bza' btung la sogs dang ldan pas //
translated: free from what is right and wrong, endowed with the strength of the body, the bestowal of bliss, food, drink, and so forth,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: thus it is said.

original: don gyi dam pa'i ye shes kyi rnam dag dpal gnyis su med pa'i blo gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: don gyi dam pa'i ye shes kyi rnam dag dpal gnyis su med pa'i blo gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The one who has the nondual mind of the glorious pure pristine consciousness of ultimate reality is just so.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum na skal bzang ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum na skal bzang ngo //
translated: He is the good fortune of the three worlds, because he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: khyab pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
translated: He is the pervasive one, because he pervades all things.

original: rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba'i rin po che mi 'dzag pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba'i rin po che mi 'dzag pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: He is the glorious one, because he is the jewel pleasing to all yoginis, and because he is the imperishable one.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir 'byor pa kun byed pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir 'byor pa kun byed pa'o //
translated: He is the bestower of all powers, because he is the basis of all perfections.

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir 'jam dpal gnyis su med pa'i dpal te ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi phyir dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir 'jam dpal gnyis su med pa'i dpal te ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi phyir dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog go //
translated: He is the glorious nonduality of Manjusri, because he is the identity of the nonduality of all things, and because he is the supreme glory, being the embodiment of intuition.

original: 'di ni sgrib pa med pa'i cha bco lnga'i rnam par dag pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin du gyur pa bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrib pa med pa'i cha bco lnga'i rnam par dag pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin du gyur pa bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the fifteen verses on the successful accomplishment of deeds, which is the intuition of successful accomplishment, the concentration of all transcendent lords, purified of the fifteen obscurations.

original: 'di ltar yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang //
translated: And also:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sgo nas skye ba'i rim pa nges par bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sgo nas skye ba'i rim pa nges par bstan to //
translated: The stages of birth through Vajrasattva and so forth are definitely taught.

original: bar bar du bzlog nas bstan pa ni man ngag sba ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: bar bar du bzlog nas bstan pa ni man ngag sba ba'i don du'o //
translated: The teaching in reverse at intervals is for the purpose of concealing the intimate instructions.

original: yang gzhom du med pa'i n'a da rgyas pa nyid kyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin du snang bas sdud pa pos de kho na bzhin du bris pa'o /
analyzed: yang gzhom du med pa'i n'a da rgyas pa nyid kyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin du snang bas sdud pa pos de kho na bzhin du bris pa'o /
translated: Moreover, since the expansion of the invincible nƒÅda appears in that way due to the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, the compiler wrote it in that way.

original: // / da ni mchog sbyin zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lngas /
analyzed: // / da ni mchog sbyin zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lngas /
translated: Now, in five verses beginning with ‚Äúgranting supreme‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das de kho na ye shes lnga'i sgo nas bstod pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de kho na ye shes lnga'i sgo nas bstod pa gsungs te ;
translated: the praise of the BhagavƒÅn is stated from the perspective of the five gnoses.

original: de la mchog sbyin rdo rje la sogs pas me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //üîΩsangs rgyas chags pa la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de la mchog sbyin rdo rje la sogs pas me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so // sangs rgyas chags pa la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Among them, granting supreme, vajra, and so on, is from the perspective of the mirror-like gnosis.üîΩBuddha, passion, and so on, is from the perspective of the gnosis of uniformity.

original: sangs rgyas 'dzum pa la sogs pas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dzum pa la sogs pas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Buddha, smile, and so on, is from the perspective of the individually discerning gnosis.

original: med pa las byung zhes pa la @92b sogs pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: med pa las byung zhes pa la @92b sogs pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The phrase arising from non-existence and so forth refers to the wisdom of successful activity.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas te /
translated: The phrase the net of illusions and so forth refers to the wisdom of the sphere of reality, which is extremely pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang / don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin du zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang / don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin du zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the five transcendent lords are the nature of Vairocana, Ratnasa·πÉbhava, AmitƒÅbha, Amoghasiddhi, and Ak·π£obhya.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos rgyu ste //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos rgyu ste //
translated: Here, the first verse is the cause.

original: lhag mas ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lhag mas ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The remaining verses are the result.

original: de bzhin du yang rgyu'i ye shes dang / rkyen gyi ye shes dang / gdan gyi ye shes dang / bsgom pa'i ye shes dang / grol pa'i ye shes te rgyu me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rgyu'i ye shes dang / rkyen gyi ye shes dang / gdan gyi ye shes dang / bsgom pa'i ye shes dang / grol pa'i ye shes te rgyu me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: Similarly, there is the wisdom of the cause, the wisdom of the condition, the wisdom of the seat, the wisdom of cultivation, and the wisdom of liberation. The cause is the mirror-like wisdom.

original: rkyen mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rkyen mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The condition is the wisdom of equality.

original: gdan so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gdan so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The seat is the wisdom of individual discernment.

original: bsgom pa'i ye shes bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i ye shes bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of meditation is the wisdom of accomplishment.

original: 'gro ba'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of beings is the wisdom of the realm of reality, which is completely pure.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang mtshon te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang mtshon te /
translated: In the same way, the five aspects of manifest, complete enlightenment are indicated.

original: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud du ye shes rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas rnam pa lnga bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud du ye shes rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas rnam pa lnga bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, in the Root Tantra, the BhagavƒÅn taught the meditation on the five aspects with five verses of praise to the five wisdoms.

original: stong par dngos po'i tshogs pa ni //
analyzed: stong par dngos po'i tshogs pa ni //
translated: The collection of things in emptiness

original: brtags pa'i gzugs ni rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gzugs ni rnam spangs pa //
translated: is the form aggregate, free from imagined form.

original: pra phab lta bur mthong 'gyur te //
analyzed: pra phab lta bur mthong 'gyur te //
translated: It is seen like a mirror divination,

original: me long gzhon nu ma yi bzhin //
analyzed: me long gzhon nu ma yi bzhin //
translated: like a young woman in a mirror.

original: zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa gzugs kyi phung po me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa gzugs kyi phung po me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the wisdom of the mirror-like aggregate of form, which is the supramundane truth.

original: dngos po thams cad mnyam gyur nas //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mnyam gyur nas //
translated: When all things become the same,

original: gcig gi dngos por 'gyur med gnas //
analyzed: gcig gi dngos por 'gyur med gnas //
translated: they abide in the state of one.üîΩThe unchanging wisdom arises

original: mi 'gyur ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ye shes las byung ba //
translated: from the unchanging.

original: chad pa ma yin rtag pa min //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag pa min //
translated: It is not annihilated, nor is it eternal.

original: zhes pa tshor ba'i phung po mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa tshor ba'i phung po mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the aggregate of feeling, the wisdom of equality.

original: yi ge 'du shes kun dag nyid //
analyzed: yi ge 'du shes kun dag nyid //
translated: The letter is the purity of perception.

original: aa yi rnam pa'i rigs las byung //
analyzed: aa yi rnam pa'i rigs las byung //
translated: It arises from the family of the form of A.

original: yi ge chen po'i go 'phang thob //
analyzed: yi ge chen po'i go 'phang thob //
translated: It attains the state of the great letter.

original: 'du shes can min 'du shes min //
analyzed: 'du shes can min 'du shes min //
translated: It is not perceived, nor is it non-perceived.

original: zhes pa 'du shes kyi phung po so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'du shes kyi phung po so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the aggregate of perception, the wisdom of individual investigation.üîΩThe unborn dharmas

original: ma skyes pa yi chos rnams dang // 'du byed dag dang bral rnams su //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yi chos rnams dang // 'du byed dag dang bral rnams su //
translated: are free from the compounded.

original: byang chub nyid min sangs rgyas min //
analyzed: byang chub nyid min sangs rgyas min //
translated: They are not enlightenment, not buddhahood,

original: sems can ma yin 'tsho ba min //
analyzed: sems can ma yin 'tsho ba min //
translated: not sentient beings, not life.

original: zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the aggregate of compositional factors, the wisdom of successful activity.

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
translated: The reality of consciousness is transcended.

original: ye shes dag pa rnyog pa med //
analyzed: ye shes dag pa rnyog pa med //
translated: Wisdom is pure and unclouded.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal chos //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal chos //
translated: The nature of phenomena is luminosity.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rtogs pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rtogs pa //
translated: The realization of the way of the dharmadhƒÅtu

original: @93a * // zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: @93a * // zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the gnosis of the sphere of reality, the extremely pure aggregate of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sdud pa'i rgyud du yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdud pa'i rgyud du yang //
translated: Similarly, in the Condensed Tantra,

original: tshigs su bcad pa brgya dang gcig la sogs pa gsum gyis 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa brgya dang gcig la sogs pa gsum gyis 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: in three verses beginning with the one hundred and first, the characteristics of the aggregates of the tathƒÅgatas, such as the wheel, are taught.

original: 'khor lo kun nas gsal ba srid gsum bde ba rin chen 'di yis chags pa nyid padma //
analyzed: 'khor lo kun nas gsal ba srid gsum bde ba rin chen 'di yis chags pa nyid padma //
translated: The wheel is the all-illuminating, the jewel is the bliss of the three worlds, the lotus is attachment itself,

original: nyon mongs zad pa ral gri de nas rdo rje yang ni ye shes sku ste dbyer med pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pa ral gri de nas rdo rje yang ni ye shes sku ste dbyer med pa //
translated: the sword is the exhaustion of afflictions, and then the vajra is the wisdom body, inseparable.

original: mi shes gcod pa gri gug mchog gi rigs drug dag kyang 'di rnams kyis ni bskyed pa gang //
analyzed: mi shes gcod pa gri gug mchog gi rigs drug dag kyang 'di rnams kyis ni bskyed pa gang //
translated: The hooked knife is the cutting of ignorance, and the six supreme families are generated by these.

original: de yang 'di ltar rig par bya ste mkha' bzhin ro mnyam phung po khams dang skye dbang sogs //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar rig par bya ste mkha' bzhin ro mnyam phung po khams dang skye dbang sogs //
translated: This should be understood as follows: The aggregates, elements, sense organs, and so forth are equal in taste like space.

original: gang du nges pa rigs kyi gzugs ni 'jig par 'gyur pa de ni gzugs chen dag tu gsungs //
analyzed: gang du nges pa rigs kyi gzugs ni 'jig par 'gyur pa de ni gzugs chen dag tu gsungs //
translated: The form of the family, which is ascertained in this way, is said to be the great form.

original: gang gi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni tshor ba chen por gsungs //üîΩgang gis 'khor ba'i 'du shes 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni 'du shes rdo rje che //
analyzed: gang gi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni tshor ba chen por gsungs // gang gis 'khor ba'i 'du shes 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni 'du shes rdo rje che //
translated: That which is the destruction of the suffering of samsara is said to be the great feeling.üîΩThat which is the destruction of the perception of samsara is the great vajra perception.

original: gang du 'khor ba 'phel ba 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni 'du byed rdo rje nyid //
analyzed: gang du 'khor ba 'phel ba 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni 'du byed rdo rje nyid //
translated: That which is the destruction of the increase of samsara is the great vajra formation.

original: gang du sad sogs gnas skabs 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de yang rnam par shes par gsungs //
analyzed: gang du sad sogs gnas skabs 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de yang rnam par shes par gsungs //
translated: That which is the destruction of the state of waking and so forth is also said to be consciousness.

original: gang du mi shes dngos por 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni thub pa'i ye shes nyid //
analyzed: gang du mi shes dngos por 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur pa de ni thub pa'i ye shes nyid //
translated: That which is the destruction of the thing of ignorance is the wisdom of the Sage.

original: 'di rnams par rnam par snang mdzad la sogs rgyal mchog dam pa rnam pa drug rnams rigs drug ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams par rnam par snang mdzad la sogs rgyal mchog dam pa rnam pa drug rnams rigs drug ste /
translated: These six, Vairochana and so forth, are the six families of the supreme, sublime victors.

original: gzhan ni khams drug dbye bas dang me dang chu dang rlung dang nam mkha' zhi ba rnams //
analyzed: gzhan ni khams drug dbye bas dang me dang chu dang rlung dang nam mkha' zhi ba rnams //
translated: The others are the six elements, divided into earth, fire, water, wind, space, and peace.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: don ni dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog ces bos pa'o //
analyzed: don ni dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog ces bos pa'o //
translated: The meaning is: because of the nature of the four joys, he is called ‚ÄúVajra of the Supreme Gift, Supreme.‚Äù

original: bde ba la longs spyod pa'i gzhi yin pas yang dag mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba la longs spyod pa'i gzhi yin pas yang dag mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is the basis of the enjoyment of bliss, so he is the ‚Äúperfect end.‚Äù

original: bde ba stong pa la sogs pa nyid kyis stong nyid las byung ngo //
analyzed: bde ba stong pa la sogs pa nyid kyis stong nyid las byung ngo //
translated: He is born from emptiness, because of the emptiness of bliss, etc.

original: dpe'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas byang chub po //
analyzed: dpe'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas byang chub po //
translated: He is the enlightenment of the buddhas, in the manner of an example.

original: 'od gsal du zhugs pa 'dud do //
analyzed: 'od gsal du zhugs pa 'dud do //
translated: He enters into clear light, he is bowed to.

original: chags pa chen po'i ngo bo'i phyir sangs rgyas chags pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa chen po'i ngo bo'i phyir sangs rgyas chags pa'o //
translated: He is the ‚Äúbuddha of passion,‚Äù because of the nature of great passion.

original: dga' bral nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i phyir sangs rgyas sku'o //
analyzed: dga' bral nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i phyir sangs rgyas sku'o //
translated: He is the ‚Äúbuddha body,‚Äù because of the dharmakƒÅya of the separation from joy.

original: sangs rgyas 'dod la zhes 'don pa ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dod par bya bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dod la zhes 'don pa ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dod par bya bas so //
translated: The reading ‚Äúbuddha of desire‚Äù is because of being desired by the buddhas.

original: stong pa nyid kyi snying po lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i skad cig nyid @93b kyis sangs rgyas dgyes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi snying po lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i skad cig nyid @93b kyis sangs rgyas dgyes pa'o //
translated: He is the ‚Äúbuddha delight,‚Äù because of the essence of emptiness, the moment of innate joy.

original: gnyis spangs pas gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i dga' ba rnyed pas sangs rgyas rol pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis spangs pas gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i dga' ba rnyed pas sangs rgyas rol pa ste /
translated: He is the ‚Äúbuddha play,‚Äù because of the attainment of the joy of nondual bliss, by the abandonment of duality.

original: 'di dag gis rkyen gyi ye shes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis rkyen gyi ye shes gsungs so //
translated: These are the three wisdoms of the conditions.

original: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes ston pa'i sbyor ba las sangs rgyas 'dzum pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes ston pa'i sbyor ba las sangs rgyas 'dzum pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's smile is from the application of the teaching of the wisdom of the nature of bliss.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i snang bas shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag khyab pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i snang bas shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag khyab pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bzhad pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's laughter is from the pervasion of the entire mandala of objects of knowledge by the light of the innate candali.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i sgo nas kyang aa wa dh'u t'i'i gnas thob pa'i srog la sogs pa'i rlung nyid kyis gzhom du med pa'i n'a nga rgyas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas gsung nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i sgo nas kyang aa wa dh'u t'i'i gnas thob pa'i srog la sogs pa'i rlung nyid kyis gzhom du med pa'i n'a nga rgyas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas gsung nyid do //
translated: The Buddha's speech is from the fact that the winds of life and so on, which have attained the state of the central channel through the action seal, are by nature invincible, being the nature of the indestructible drop.

original: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dang pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas thugs so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dang pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas thugs so //
translated: The Buddha's mind is from the fact that the enjoyment body is inseparable from the dharma body.

original: stong pa nyid las byung ba'i sku bzhi'i phyir med pa las byung ngo //üîΩngo bo nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las byung ba'i sku bzhi'i phyir med pa las byung ngo // ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The Buddha's origin is from the four bodies of enlightenment that arise from emptiness.üîΩThe Buddha's emergence is from the nature of the Buddha.

original: rang byung gi ngo bo'i phyir nam mkha' las byung ngo //
analyzed: rang byung gi ngo bo'i phyir nam mkha' las byung ngo //
translated: The Buddha's appearance is from the nature of self-origination.

original: bzhi las 'das shing yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir ye shes las byung ngo //
analyzed: bzhi las 'das shing yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir ye shes las byung ngo //
translated: Since it is beyond the four and is to be known by oneself as beyond existence and nonexistence, it arises from gnosis.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen mo las byung ba'i mchog tu bde ba nyid kyi phyir sgyu 'phrul dra ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen mo las byung ba'i mchog tu bde ba nyid kyi phyir sgyu 'phrul dra ba'o //
translated: Since it is the supreme bliss that arises from the great magical illusion, it is the magical net.

original: lhan skyes kyis khyab pa'i brtan g-yo'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rol ston no //
analyzed: lhan skyes kyis khyab pa'i brtan g-yo'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rol ston no //
translated: Since it pervades the animate and inanimate world with the connate [joy], it is the display of the buddhas.

original: thams cad du bod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du bod pa'o //
translated: It is everywhere.

original: dga' ba bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis mang pa'i phyir thams cad thams cad do //
analyzed: dga' ba bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid kyis mang pa'i phyir thams cad thams cad do //
translated: Since it is abundant with the nature of the sixteen joys, it is all of everything.

original: kun du bzang po'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi sku'i gtso bo'i phyir ye shes sku nyid do //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi sku'i gtso bo'i phyir ye shes sku nyid do //
translated: Since it is the principal body of the gnosis of the great bliss of Samantabhadra, it is the body of gnosis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o /
translated: Five verses in praise of the gnosis of the five transcendent ones.

original: // / da ni phan yon gyi tshig rkang rnams kyang cung zad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni phan yon gyi tshig rkang rnams kyang cung zad bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain a little the verses on the benefits.

original: 'di ni zhen pa mngon sum du nyams su myong bzhin pa'i bde ba rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhen pa mngon sum du nyams su myong bzhin pa'i bde ba rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: This is because the bliss that is directly experienced as attachment is realized just as it is.

original: 'od gsal gyi phyir ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi phyir ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: It is the j√±ƒÅnakƒÅya because of luminosity.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: This Praise in Honor of the Thirty-three is the experience of the connate.

original: rtag tu lhan skyes dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi 'dod yon lnga la longs spyod kyang nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu lhan skyes dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi 'dod yon lnga la longs spyod kyang nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is completely pure and unadulterated because one always enjoys the five sense objects that are by nature the connate purity, and they are not mixed with afflictions.

original: lam bla na med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir dga' ba bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: lam bla na med pa'i ngo bo'i phyir dga' ba bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unexcelled joy because it is the essence of the unexcelled path.

original: nyams su myong bzhin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang po'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong bzhin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang po'o //
translated: It is the first because it has the characteristic of being experienced.

original: yid ches pa brtan pa'i phyir mgu ba chen po bla na med pa'o //üîΩbyang @94a * //
analyzed: yid ches pa brtan pa'i phyir mgu ba chen po bla na med pa'o // byang @94a * //
translated: It is unexcelled great delight because it is firm confidence.

original: sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin nyid kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gsad pa'o //
analyzed: sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin nyid kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gsad pa'o //
translated: It is the mantra vehicle because it is the vehicle of the bodhisattva.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The way of the sublime Dharma is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang dag par gzung ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi tshul nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dag par gzung ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi tshul nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the very method of the gnosis of non-duality.

original: sbyor ba yan lag drug gi kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin byang sems rdo rje rab tu bshad pa'i phyir bstan pa la sogs pa'i tshig drug go //
analyzed: sbyor ba yan lag drug gi kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin byang sems rdo rje rab tu bshad pa'i phyir bstan pa la sogs pa'i tshig drug go //
translated: The six verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe teaching‚Äù are for the sake of explaining the nature of the relative and ultimate bodhicitta, which is the six-branched yoga.

original: byin gyis brlab pa ni brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa ni brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the stabilization.

original: 'khor lo drug la gnas pa'i phyir re zhig 'khor lo dang po'i phan yon no //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug la gnas pa'i phyir re zhig 'khor lo dang po'i phan yon no //
translated: The benefits of the first wheel are due to the six wheels.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis of omniscience is due to the natural luminosity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni bzhi pa'i ye shes nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni bzhi pa'i ye shes nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The enlightenment of the Buddha is the experience of the fourth gnosis.

original: mngon par rtogs pa ni 'od gsal snang ba med pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ni 'od gsal snang ba med pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The realization is the direct perception of the luminosity of non-appearance.

original: chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud pa ni rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud pa ni rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The comprehension of the dharmadhƒÅtu is due to the nature of emptiness in all aspects.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs nyid ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs nyid ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of the ten powers is the power of the ten signs such as smoke and so forth.

original: bde ba chen po nyid du 'ong ba'i phyir lung ngo //
analyzed: bde ba chen po nyid du 'ong ba'i phyir lung ngo //
translated: It is the scripture because it is the coming of great bliss.

original: lhun gyis grub pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir yang dag par grub pa'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir yang dag par grub pa'o //
translated: It is the perfect accomplishment because it is the nature of the realization of the effortless.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from all elaborations.

original: stong pa nyid kyi phyir sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs mthong ba'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi phyir sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs mthong ba'i skye gnas so //
translated: It is the birthplace of seeing the form of the buddha of the emanation body because of emptiness.

original: rtsa'i 'khor lo yongs su dag pa'i dag nyid kyi phyir zhing ngo //
analyzed: rtsa'i 'khor lo yongs su dag pa'i dag nyid kyi phyir zhing ngo //
translated: It is the field because of the purity of the pure nature of the cakras.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo gnas pa'i phyir gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo gnas pa'i phyir gzhi'o //
translated: It is the basis because of the nature of the abiding of the result.

original: kun rdzob theg pa chen po dang dam pa rdo rje theg pa'i spyod pa mi 'gal ba'i ngo bo'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob theg pa chen po dang dam pa rdo rje theg pa'i spyod pa mi 'gal ba'i ngo bo'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: It is the conduct of the bodhisattvas because of the nature of the noncontradictory conduct of the MahƒÅyƒÅna and the supreme VajrayƒÅna of the relative.

original: mthar thug thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mtha'o //
analyzed: mthar thug thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mtha'o //
translated: It is the end because it is the cause of attaining the ultimate.

original: de kho na nyid brtag pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid brtag pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir brtag pa'o //
translated: It is an investigation because it is the basis of the investigation of reality.

original: nges par 'byung ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: It is a place of birth because it is the special means of liberation.

original: lhun gyis grub pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa byed pa'i phyir gdung mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa byed pa'i phyir gdung mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is a family because it is the spontaneous performance of the Tathagata's deeds.

original: 'od gsal byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir rab tu 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir rab tu 'phel ba'o //
translated: It is an increase because it is the consecration of the light.

original: khyab byed yin pa'i phyir sdud pa'o //
analyzed: khyab byed yin pa'i phyir sdud pa'o //
translated: It is a collection because it is all-pervading.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is a samadhi because it is of the nature of the inconceivable.

original: shes rab la sogs pas bsam gtan rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir bsam @94b gtan no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pas bsam gtan rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir bsam @94b gtan no //
translated: It is a dhyana because it is the nature of the five dhyanas such as wisdom.

original: ye shes tsam nyid gzhi yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: ye shes tsam nyid gzhi yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ro //
translated: It is yoga because it is the basis of mere consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams snang ba med pa'i phyir spong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams snang ba med pa'i phyir spong ba'o //
translated: It is a relinquishment because it is the non-appearance of conceptualization.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i 'ching ba dang bral ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir grol ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i 'ching ba dang bral ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir grol ba'o //
translated: It is liberation because it is the cause of freedom from the bonds of attachment and so forth.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir thar pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir thar pa'o //
translated: It is liberation because it is the nature of perfect pristine consciousness.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba la gnas pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba la gnas pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it abides in the bliss of the connate state.

original: 'od gsal nyid kyi 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: 'od gsal nyid kyi 'byung gnas so //
translated: It is the source of luminosity.

original: rgud pa thams cad ni skyon thams cad do //
analyzed: rgud pa thams cad ni skyon thams cad do //
translated: All misfortunes are all faults.

original: ngan song gi sgo thams cad de dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro ste ngan 'gro thams cad do //
analyzed: ngan song gi sgo thams cad de dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro ste ngan 'gro thams cad do //
translated: All the doors of the lower realms are the lower realms of hell beings, pretas, and animals.

original: kha gcod dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'gebs pa'o //
analyzed: kha gcod dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'gebs pa'o //
translated: It is a cover because it is like a lid.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin pa'i phyir lam bzang pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin pa'i phyir lam bzang pa'o //
translated: It is the good path because it is the path of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'chad pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'chad pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is nonengagement because it interrupts dependent origination.

original: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bskor ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bskor ba'o //
translated: It is the wheel because it is the cause of turning the wheel of dharma according to fortune.

original: rdo rje theg pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngo bo'i phyir gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngo bo'i phyir gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba'o //
translated: The parasol, banner, and flag are raised because of the nature of the Vajra Vehicle's victory over the Hearers and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor brtan par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor brtan par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnas so //
translated: The abode is the cause of stabilizing the yoga.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa sngags kyi tshig klog pa la sogs pa rnams kyis myur du grub pa 'thob pa'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa sngags kyi tshig klog pa la sogs pa rnams kyis myur du grub pa 'thob pa'o ;
translated: The mantra is the swift attainment of the practice of the Bodhisattva who practices the gateway of mantra, by means of the recitation of the mantra words and so forth.

original: / mngon sum du byed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir bsgom pa la sogs par brtson pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: / mngon sum du byed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir bsgom pa la sogs par brtson pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization is for those who strive in meditation and so forth, because of the nature of direct realization.

original: stong pa nyid kyi bye brag grub pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid so sor rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi bye brag grub pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid so sor rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of emptiness is the nature of the tenets of the distinctions of emptiness.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis su med pa so sor rtog par mngon par brtson ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis su med pa so sor rtog par mngon par brtson ba rnams so //
translated: The non-dual realization is for those who strive in the realization of the nature of cause and effect.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is the nature of non-conceptual discernment.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi phyir chos thams cad sems rtse gcig gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi phyir chos thams cad sems rtse gcig gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of all dharmas with a one-pointed mind because it is non-dual gnosis.

original: mtshan ma ngan pa 'chi ba'i mtshan ma la sogs pa dang / lha'i bu la sogs pa phag pa'i mngal du skyes pa'i phyir dri ngan pa la sogs pa'i ltas ngan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ngan pa 'chi ba'i mtshan ma la sogs pa dang / lha'i bu la sogs pa phag pa'i mngal du skyes pa'i phyir dri ngan pa la sogs pa'i ltas ngan pa'o //
translated: It is the inauspicious signs such as the inauspicious signs of death, and the inauspicious signs of bad smells, etc., such as being born in the womb of a pig as a son of the gods, etc.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po la sogs pa bsgoms pa nyid kyis bdud kyi dgra'i las ring du spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po la sogs pa bsgoms pa nyid kyis bdud kyi dgra'i las ring du spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the deeds of the enemy Mara by the mere meditation on the Great Mandala of the Vajra Realm, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad thob pa'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa thams cad @95a * //üîΩmi skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad thob pa'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa thams cad @95a * // mi skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the non-arising of all improper mental activities because it is the attainment of all samadhis.

original: snyems pa'i sems kyi spyod pa rgyags pa'o //
analyzed: snyems pa'i sems kyi spyod pa rgyags pa'o //
translated: It is the conduct of a conceited mind, which is arrogance.

original: ha cang nga rgyal che ba ni dregs pa'o //
analyzed: ha cang nga rgyal che ba ni dregs pa'o //
translated: It is haughtiness, which is excessive pride.

original: bdag gir 'dzin pa ni ngar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pa ni ngar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is egoism, which is self-grasping.

original: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Suffering is physical.

original: yid mi bde ba ni sems kyi'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni sems kyi'o //
translated: Mental suffering is mental.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa des par 'byung ba'i phyir snying por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa des par 'byung ba'i phyir snying por gyur pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the essence because he is the source.

original: mchog tu sba bar bya ba'i phyir gsang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu sba bar bya ba'i phyir gsang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the secret because he is the supreme secret.

original: gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi rim pa kho nas bstan pa'i phyir gsang chen du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi rim pa kho nas bstan pa'i phyir gsang chen du gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the great secret because he is taught only through the stages of the mantra method.

original: nam par rtog pa med pa'i las kyi phyag rgyal sogs pa bsten pa'i rgyu'i phyir phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags thams cad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nam par rtog pa med pa'i las kyi phyag rgyal sogs pa bsten pa'i rgyu'i phyir phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags thams cad du gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the seal of all mantras and the source of all seals because he is the cause of the practice of the seal of non-conceptual action, and so forth.

original: nad med pa ni nad dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: nad med pa ni nad dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Health is freedom from disease.

original: stobs ni lus kyi nus pa'o //
analyzed: stobs ni lus kyi nus pa'o //
translated: Strength is physical ability.

original: dbang phyug ni glang chen la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni glang chen la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sovereignty is elephants and so forth.

original: phun sum tshogs pa ni nor dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ni nor dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Prosperity is wealth, crops, and so forth.

original: dpal ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Glory is non-duality.

original: dge ba ni dge ba bcu gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni dge ba bcu gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Virtue is the ten virtues being primary.

original: zhi ba ni rnal 'byor goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rnal 'byor goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Peace is due to cultivating yoga.

original: legs pa ni thog ma dang bar dang tha mar bkra shis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs pa ni thog ma dang bar dang tha mar bkra shis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Excellent means auspicious in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: grags pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyis rab tu gang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyis rab tu gang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Renowned means filled with the thought of awakening.

original: snyan pa ni dbang la sogs pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pa ni dbang la sogs pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Famous means teaching the powers, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni sangs rgyas nyid ster ba po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni sangs rgyas nyid ster ba po'i phyir ro //
translated: Verse means bestowing buddhahood.

original: bstod pa ni lam ster bas so //
analyzed: bstod pa ni lam ster bas so //
translated: Praise means bestowing the path.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs pas spros pa'i dri ma thams cad bkrus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs pas spros pa'i dri ma thams cad bkrus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Very pure means all the stains of conceptual elaboration are washed away by completing the accumulation of merit.

original: shin tu dag byed ni ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa nyid kyis snying gi gnas ngan len gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu dag byed ni ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa nyid kyis snying gi gnas ngan len gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Very purifying means the impurities of the abode of the heart are clarified by accumulating the knowledge accumulation.

original: mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jog pa po nyid kyi phyir shin tu bkra shis pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jog pa po nyid kyi phyir shin tu bkra shis pa'o //
translated: Very auspicious means it is the abode of the Buddha qualities, which are placed in the consciousnesses of the tƒ´rthikas, etc.

original: mgon med pa rnams kyi skyabs su gyur pas skyabs so //
analyzed: mgon med pa rnams kyi skyabs su gyur pas skyabs so //
translated: Refuge means it becomes the refuge of the helpless.

original: dga' ba'i rgyu'i phyir gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyu'i phyir gnas so //
translated: Abode means it is the cause of joy.üîΩ

original: rang rang gi chos kyis skyob par 'dod pa rnams bskyab pa'i phyir skyob pa'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi chos kyis skyob par 'dod pa rnams bskyab pa'i phyir skyob pa'o //
translated: It is a refuge because it protects those who desire protection by means of its own Dharma.

original: yongs su skyob byed dang bral ba rnams kyi dpung gnyen no //
analyzed: yongs su skyob byed dang bral ba rnams kyi dpung gnyen no //
translated: It is a friend for those who are without a protector.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong thob pa'i phyir grir ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong thob pa'i phyir grir ngo //
translated: It is a city because it obtains the city of nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad ni nad thams cad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad ni nad thams cad do //
translated: The eighty-eight defilements are all the sicknesses.

original: rnam pa thams cad rnams pa med pa'i stong ba nyid ston pas ye shes kyi snang @95b ba'o ;
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rnams pa med pa'i stong ba nyid ston pas ye shes kyi snang @95b ba'o ;
translated: It is the light of knowledge because it teaches the emptiness that is the absence of all aspects and the absence of non-aspects.

original: / spyan lnga ni sha'i spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / spyan lnga ni sha'i spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five eyes are the fleshly eye, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa me dpa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o//üîΩaa wa dh'u t'ir son pa nyid kyis sgro 'dogs thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir chos nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa me dpa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o// aa wa dh'u t'ir son pa nyid kyis sgro 'dogs thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir chos nyid do //
translated: It is non-dual because it is free from the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.üîΩIt is reality because it is free from all superimpositions by virtue of being located in the avadhuti.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the inexpressible nature of all dharmas because it is without intrinsic nature.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i spyad pa spyod pas na de de bzhin no //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i spyad pa spyod pas na de de bzhin no //
translated: The word indeed is used because they practice the activities of listening, reflecting, and meditating by means of the mantra approach.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs las byung ba rnams ming kho na gtsug gi nor bu ni ming gi gtsug gi nor bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs las byung ba rnams ming kho na gtsug gi nor bu ni ming gi gtsug gi nor bu'o //
translated: Those who have arisen from the Tathagata's lineage are crown jewels of names because they are crown jewels of names.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan mtshang ba med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan mtshang ba med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: They are fully complete because they are endowed with the Buddha's qualities without deficiency.

original: chos thams cad kyi don yongs su rdzogs pas ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi don yongs su rdzogs pas ma nyams pa'o //
translated: They are unimpaired because they are fully complete in the meaning of all Dharma.

original: lhag chad med pas zil gyis non par mi nus pa'o //üîΩgzhung dang / don 'chang ba dang / dkyil 'khor sngon du 'gro bas glegs bam klog pa dang / sems pas kun chub par byed pa dang / bsgoms pas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag chad med pas zil gyis non par mi nus pa'o // gzhung dang / don 'chang ba dang / dkyil 'khor sngon du 'gro bas glegs bam klog pa dang / sems pas kun chub par byed pa dang / bsgoms pas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: They are unsurpassable because they are free from excess and deficiency.üîΩThey are unobstructed because they are endowed with the four unobstructed abilities.üîΩThey are unconquerable because they are endowed with the ten powers.

original: mdangs dang / stobs dang / gzi brjid zil gyis mi non pa zil gyis mnan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdangs dang / stobs dang / gzi brjid zil gyis mi non pa zil gyis mnan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: They are unshakable because they are endowed with the four forms of fearlessness.üîΩThey are unassailable because they are endowed with the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddhas.üîΩThey are unshakable because they are endowed with the four forms of intrepid confidence.

original: gzi brjid zil gyis mi non pa ni //
analyzed: gzi brjid zil gyis mi non pa ni //
translated: Invincible splendor is

original: gzi brjid nang du 'phro ba nor bu bdag nyid chen po'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid nang du 'phro ba nor bu bdag nyid chen po'o //
translated: the great jewel nature of splendor.

original: phyir bzlog pa ni gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyir bzlog pa ni gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: Repelling is the antidote.

original: snyigs ma lnga ni sems can dang // lta ba dang / bskal ba dang / tshe dang / yo byad kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga ni sems can dang // lta ba dang / bskal ba dang / tshe dang / yo byad kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The five degenerations are the characteristics of sentient beings, views, eons, life, and resources.

original: dri ngas dang / skur ba dang / smad pa'i tshig sngon du 'gro bas mi snyan pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dri ngas dang / skur ba dang / smad pa'i tshig sngon du 'gro bas mi snyan pa brjod pa'o //
translated: Reproach is the unpleasant speech preceded by the words of blame and contempt.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni yid du 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni yid du 'thad pa'o //
translated: Pleasant is agreeable.

original: phyogs bcur dam pa'i chos kyi rnga sgra rgyun mi 'chad par sgrogs pa gang yin pa de lta bu chos kyi rgyal po zhes pa chos kyi rgyal srid kyi bdag por 'gyur ro zhes 'brel ba'o //üîΩaom sarbba dha rmm'a bh'a ba sva bh'a ba bi shuddha badzra aa a'a /
analyzed: phyogs bcur dam pa'i chos kyi rnga sgra rgyun mi 'chad par sgrogs pa gang yin pa de lta bu chos kyi rgyal po zhes pa chos kyi rgyal srid kyi bdag por 'gyur ro zhes 'brel ba'o // aom sarbba dha rmm'a bh'a ba sva bh'a ba bi shuddha badzra aa a'a /
translated: The one who is like that, the Dharma King, the lord of the kingdom of Dharma, will proclaim the drumbeat of the holy Dharma in the ten directions without interruption.üîΩOm sarva dharma bhava svabhava visuddha vajra a a.

original: aam aa: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha: sarbba dha rmm'a: ya du ta /
analyzed: aam aa: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha: sarbba dha rmm'a: ya du ta /
translated: Am ah. Prakritaparisuddha sarva dharmas yadat.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na k'a ya /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na k'a ya /
translated: Sarva-tathƒÅgata-j√±ƒÅna-kƒÅyaüîΩMa√±ju≈õrƒ´-pari≈õuddhi-tƒÅm-upƒÅdƒÅya-etam-ƒÅ·∏•

original: manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi t'a mu p'a da ye ta aam a'a: sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya /
analyzed: manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi t'a mu p'a da ye ta aam a'a: sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya /
translated: Sarva-tathƒÅgata-hrdaya

original: ha ra ha ra /
analyzed: ha ra ha ra /
translated: Hara-haraüîΩO·πÉ h≈´·πÉ hrƒ´·∏•

original: aom h'um hr'i: bha ga b'an dzny'a na m'u rti /
analyzed: aom h'um hr'i: bha ga b'an dzny'a na m'u rti /
translated: Bha-ga-va-n-j√±ƒÅna-m≈´rti

original: b'a g'i shva ra ma h'a b'a tsa /
analyzed: b'a g'i shva ra ma h'a b'a tsa /
translated: VƒÅgƒ´≈õvara-mahƒÅ-vƒÅcaüîΩSarva-dharmƒÅ-gagana-amala-supari≈õuddha-dharma-dhƒÅtu-j√±ƒÅna-garbha-ƒÅ·∏•

original: sarbba dharmma ga ga n'a ma la su pa ri shuddha dha rma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a: 'di ni dang po dang / bar dang / tha mar byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: sarbba dharmma ga ga n'a ma la su pa ri shuddha dha rma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a: 'di ni dang po dang / bar dang / tha mar byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for the consecration at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: de ltar yang /üîΩaa'i rnam pa byang @96a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang / aa'i rnam pa byang @96a * //
translated: In this way,

original: chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: chub kyi sems so //
translated: The form of ƒÅ·∏• is the bodhicitta.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rang bzhin aa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rang bzhin aa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The nature of practicing the stages and perfections is the form of ƒÅ·∏•.

original: sangs rgyas nyid mtshon pa aam gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid mtshon pa aam gi rnam pa'o //
translated: The illustration of buddhahood is the form of a·πÉ.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gsal bar byed pa aa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gsal bar byed pa aa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The illumination of great nirvƒÅ·πáa is the form of ƒÅ.

original: ye shes kyi sku byin gyis rlob pa po aa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku byin gyis rlob pa po aa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The consecrator of the j√±ƒÅnakƒÅya is the form of ƒÅ.

original: lus dang sems dang ngag byin gyis rlob pa po aom h'um hri'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems dang ngag byin gyis rlob pa po aom h'um hri'i yi ge'o //
translated: The consecration of body, mind, and speech is the syllables Om, Hum, and Hrih.

original: brtan dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo'i dngos po rnams chos rnams kyi dbyings /
analyzed: brtan dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo'i dngos po rnams chos rnams kyi dbyings /
translated: The nature of all things, animate and inanimate, is the realm of phenomena.

original: ngag gi dbang phyug gi bdag nyid ces pa'o don to //
analyzed: ngag gi dbang phyug gi bdag nyid ces pa'o don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of the Lord of Speech.

original: chos kyi sku rgyas gdab pa'i don du aa:'i rnam pa thams cad brjod do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku rgyas gdab pa'i don du aa:'i rnam pa thams cad brjod do //
translated: For the sake of the consecration of the Dharma Body, the syllable Ah is uttered in all its aspects.

original: de nas shes pa de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas shes pa de ma thag tu'o //
translated: Then, immediately after that knowledge,

original: gang gis dang por gsol ba btab pa'i dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang des /
analyzed: gang gis dang por gsol ba btab pa'i dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang des /
translated: the glorious Vajradhara, who was first requested,

original: gsang bstod nas ni tshig 'di gsol //
analyzed: gsang bstod nas ni tshig 'di gsol //
translated: having praised the secret, uttered these words.

original: zhes 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: zhes 'brel pa'o //
translated: This is the connection.

original: de nyid kyi tshe bde ba skyes pas dga' zhing ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe bde ba skyes pas dga' zhing ngo //
translated: At that very time, he was delighted by the arising of bliss.

original: slad nas dga' ba skyes pas mgu nas so //
analyzed: slad nas dga' ba skyes pas mgu nas so //
translated: Later, he was pleased by the arising of joy.

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i legs pa'i lam sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud kyi tshul bstan cing bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i legs pa'i lam sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud kyi tshul bstan cing bshad pa'o //
translated: The path of excellence for attaining perfect complete enlightenment is taught and explained in the manner of the Net of Illusion Tantra.

original: don chen rang bzhin gyi don 'byung ba'i rgyun no //
analyzed: don chen rang bzhin gyi don 'byung ba'i rgyun no //
translated: The great meaning is the stream of the arising of the intrinsic meaning.

original: lam 'di yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul te spyod yul yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: lam 'di yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul te spyod yul yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: This path is also the domain of the Buddhas, it is their sphere of activity, not that of others.

original: rdo rjes mtshan dpal phyag na snying po bcom ldan 'jig rten dbang phyug 'grel chen rjes su 'gro //
analyzed: rdo rjes mtshan dpal phyag na snying po bcom ldan 'jig rten dbang phyug 'grel chen rjes su 'gro //
translated: The glorious Vajra-heart-in-hand, the Lord of the world, the Blessed One, is the guide of the great commentary.

original: legs bsngags don zab dag la brten cing rmad byung kha che'i dka' 'grel rgyas pa dbang por ldan //
analyzed: legs bsngags don zab dag la brten cing rmad byung kha che'i dka' 'grel rgyas pa dbang por ldan //
translated: The excellent praise is based on the profound meaning, and the extensive Kashmiri commentary is the sense organ.

original: sna tshogs rgyud kyi gsang chen rnam par g-yo ldan gdams pa sna tshogs bdud rtsis rgyas gyur pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyud kyi gsang chen rnam par g-yo ldan gdams pa sna tshogs bdud rtsis rgyas gyur pa //
translated: The various great secrets of the tantra are endowed with the various instructions, which are the nectar that causes growth.üîΩMay this brief explanation, the glory of the sun, completely fill the minds of the holy ones.

original: nyi ma'i dpal gyis mdor bshad 'di ni dam pa rnams kyi sems la kun nas rgyas gyur cig / mdor bshad bdud rtsi'i thigs pa ma 'khrugs shing //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dpal gyis mdor bshad 'di ni dam pa rnams kyi sems la kun nas rgyas gyur cig / mdor bshad bdud rtsi'i thigs pa ma 'khrugs shing //
translated: The brief explanation, the drop of nectar, is unconfusedüîΩand pleasing.üîΩFrom the merit I have obtained

original: yid 'ong brtsams las bdag gis bsod nams ni //
analyzed: yid 'ong brtsams las bdag gis bsod nams ni //
translated: from composing this,

original: gang zhig thob pa de yis 'gro ba rnams //
